He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. C. is from the village of Research Minante 1 in Cauayan City. She is 57 years old. Fe is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe sells fruit, frozen fish, and vegetables in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Fe's eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
 
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden C. is from the village of Bayabas in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old. Eden is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling charcoal in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eden joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eden from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rose Nyaboke

texts.en:
Rose Nyaboke O., 21, is married to Shaliff O. and together they have three children who all attend school. Rose is a businesswoman with a fruit canteen business that she has been running for the last three years on a busy street in the town of Narok.

Rose learned about KADET from other women already registered as clients. This will be her third loan. She is planning to use it to increase her green grocer stock, buy some equipment to assist in fruit processing and open up another fruit shop to meet her customers’ demands. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people.

Rose's future dream is to be able to build her own store and her own house. She also believes she is hardworking and only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy fruit blenders, a fridge, bananas and pinapples and to open up another fruit shop

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel tiene 51 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera tienes tres hijos de las edades de 27, 11 y 14 años todos solteros, ella tiene una venta de pupusas y comida.
El negocio de venta de comida lo administra hace mas de 10 años y la venta de pupusas 5 años fue por iniciativa propia el dedicarse al negocio, lo atiende en un  horario de 7:00 am - 6:00 pm, todos los días de la semana, está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales como son: carne de pollo, carne de res, tomates cebolla, papa, aceite, maíz y especies que le servirán para generar más ingresos, prestar un mejor servicios a los clientes ofrecerles más productos, esto le permitirá cubrir gastos de alimentación de la familia y otras necesidades. 
Las aspiraciones de Ana son hacer crecer el negocio para sacar adelante a los hijos, apoyarlos con los estudios hasta que se formen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel, age 51, lives in San Miguel. She is a single mother, and she has three children. They are 27, 11, and 14 years old. They are all single. She has a business selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and other food. She has run her food selling business for over ten years and her business of selling pupusas for five years. She started the business on her own initiative. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day of the week. She is requesting a loan to buy materials like chicken, beef, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, oil, corn, and spices. They will serve to generate more income, give her customers better service, and give her customers more products. This will allow her to cover the family’s food expenses and other necessities. Ana’s aspirations are to make her business grow in order to get her children ahead and to support them in their education until they are trained professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, beef, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, oil, corn, and spices

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr:
Madame Nogaye S. habite à Bambilor. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 26 ans. 
Elle a choisi l’activité  de commerce pour soutenir son mari dont les moyens sont  limités. Ainsi donc elle s’adonne depuis 16 ans à la commercialisation de légumes. 
Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis le mois de mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs pour acheter des légumes  et des condiments en vue de renforcer son étal. Ce crédit pourrait participer a l’accroissement de ses profits ce qui lui donnera l’occasion d’aider ses enfants à assurer les frais d’inscription et de scolarité et aussi a  payer leurs fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
Mme Nogaye S. lives in Bambilor. She is married with five children aged between 10 and 26. She went into business to help out her husband, whose means are limted, For 16 years she has sold vegetables. She has belonged to the Bambilor caisse since May of 2010. She's asking for a loan of Fr 100,000 to buy vegetables and seasoning to stock her market stall. The loan will help to grow her profit so that she can pay her children's school fees and buy their school supplies.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to working capital

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna P. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 34 years old. Johna is single. To make a living, Johna runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products, like candy and soft drinks, to the local community. Johna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Johna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Johna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Johna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo P. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. He is 47 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. Rodolfo owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin  vive zona  Quillviri, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz , se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche lo vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche), también trabaja como conductor de maquinaria pesada en el alcaldía de su zona, vive junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. El crédito será destinado a la compra de ganado. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Franklin lives in the Quillviri area, in the Aroma province in the Departament of La Paz. He breeds bovine cattle whose milk production is sold to Pil Andina (Milk Industrializing Factory). Also, he works as a driver of heavy equipment in his local town hall. He lives with his wife and children, who are of school age. The loan will be used to buy cattle. This is his first loan with Impro and his first loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bovine cattle

loans.name: Chuk

texts.en:
Chuk T., 26, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, which is known for being a cross-border business area with Vietnam. Chuk T. is a farmer for an income of $3 US per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $6 per day.

T. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buying a motorbike

loans.name: Giancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo es un joven de 18 años de edad que reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Guaraguaos del distrito de Tambogrande. Una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y venta de ovejas. El cría ovejas en su casa y las vende vivas a los negociantes de la zona o sacrificadas a sus vecinos. Este negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Giancarlo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más ovejas y alimento balanceado de modo que su nivel de ingresos aumente y que esto le permita realizar otras acciones como estudiar una carrera superior. Por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Giancarlo es un joven responsable y emprendedor, las personas que le conocen le tienen bastante estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is an18 year-old young man who lives with his parents and siblings in the town of Guaraguaos in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area of the province of Piura. It is located in a region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque province.

He has been raising and selling sheep for more than one year. He raises sheep at his house and then sells them alive to businesspeople in the area, or already killed to his neighbors. This business allows him to cover his personal expenses and help his parents provide for the family.

Giancarlo would like to expand his business by buying more sheep and feed so that his income can increase, which would allow him to do other things, such as study for a higher degree. So, he has decided for the first time to request a loan of PEN 400.00 from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Giancarlo is a responsible and enterprising young man. Those who know him hold him in high esteem and trust in him.

loans.use: To buy sheep and feed so he can expand his business of raising and selling sheep.

loans.name: Erinest

texts.en:
Erinest is a 47-year-old man who is married to a peasant farmer and together they have eight children. He looks after a family of ten people and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in his own family house. His major dreams for the family are basically to educate his children and improve the household income.
Erinest is a tailor and has been in the business for 25 years now. Before being a tailor, Erinest was a farmer but opted to change his business sector to tailoring. He says he is doing better in terms of income generation than he would if he was still a farmer. He intends to use the loan proceeds to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for the children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe, in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. One of her children is currently in school. Irene has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Irene hopes to own a garment shop.  Irene is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Zuena Munga

texts.en:
Zuena Munga N. is 30 years old and married to Mohammed Mwanza, an employee at Athi River Cement. Together they are blessed with three children. Zuena is a soap and kerosene supplier from the city of Mwele.

This will be her first loan with KADET, and Zuena plans to purchase kerosene and soap. She will direct the anticipated profits into adding more stock. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene and soap

loans.name: Zion 1 Group

texts.en:
These five women are some of the 100 members of the  Zion Center, They are all neighbors. Analyn A. and Evangeline S. have a livestock business, and their husbands are working in construction. Lilian E. and Emma Fe M. have a sari store and Mila D. has a food business.
These members have a good record in the center - they paid their previous loan cycle with no problems.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en: Cayetana belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 59 years old and married with two children. She wants the loan to invest in her bread-making business. The city of Oropesa, is famous for making bread. Cayetana will use the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make her bread which she sells in the nearby city of Huancarane. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in her bakery

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor M., age 57, is married to Yen, age 58.  They have three children, all of whom are employed as garment workers. She and her husband have been earning a living for many years by cultivating rice crops. They have had experience in this sector since 1985. This family usually generates an income of approximately $5 each day to use for all the family expenses. 

Sor M. says that her savings account is currently not sufficient to assist her daughter to have her wedding, which coming soon. To deal with this situation, Sor M. is seeking a loan to help her daughter hold her wedding ceremony.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de CD, DVD y discos en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, es un hombre responsable que disfruta de su negocio, tiene 1 hijo de 10 años a su cargo. La ubicación de su negocio es en el parque donde transitan muchos clientes y le solicitan diferentes pedidos de discos él siempre se preocupa por complacerlos. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como películas recientes, disco de música entre otros.
texts.en:
Fernando is 38 years old and has a business selling CDs, DVDs, and other types of discs. He has been in this business for more than ten years. Fernando is a responsible man who enjoys his work. He has a ten year old son under his care. His business is located in a park where many customers pass by and request different types of discs. He is always concerned with trying to please them.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise, such as the most recent movies, music discs, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase the most recent movies, music discs, and other items

loans.name: Gladys Xiomara

texts.es:
Doña Gladis Xiomara tiene 40 años de edad y es la propietaria de la caseta que se encuentra ubicada dentro de la Escuela “MANUEL DE ADALID Y GAMERO” en donde se imparten clases en dos jornadas: matutina y vespertina dicho centro que cuenta con una asistencia de 750 alumnos promedio diarios.
Doña Gladis no tiene competencia dentro de la escuela ya que es la única cafetería que esta dentro de la misma y por seguridad de los alumnos tampoco los dejan salir a comprar afuera de dicha escuela.

Doña Gladis esta casada y junto a su esposo han procreado 3 hijos, que dependen de ellos, su esposo es técnico en salud y trabaja para el Ministerio de Salud Pública como promotor de salud.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar alimentos y refrescos al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y asi tener mas ganancias.
para bajar sus costos ella produce las tortillas de harina para las baleadas, tambien todas las comidas las fabrica ella, lo unico que compra son las donas, reposteria empaquetada y refrescos, en todas las demas comidas compra los materiales y ella las fabrica.
texts.en:
Gladis Xiomara, age 40, is the proprietor of the stall in the Manuel de Adalid y Gamero School.  Classes are taught in two shifts, morning and evening.  The center has an average of 750 students attending daily.

Gladis does not have competition in the school.  Hers is the only snack bar in the school, and for security purposes the students are not allowed to leave to buy food outside of the school.

Gladis is married.  She and her husband have three children who are dependent upon them.  Her husband is a health technician, and he works for the Ministry of Public Health as a health advisor.

She will use the loan to buy food and soft drinks wholesale in order to get better prices and better income.  To lower her costs she makes the flour tortillas for the baleadas [the basic baleada is a thick flour tortilla folded in half containing refried beans and grated queso duro (a hard salty white cheese), and mantequilla (a white sauce much like sour cream].  She also makes all of the meals.  The only things that she buys are the doughnuts, packaged pastries, and soft drinks.  She buys the ingredients and makes all of the other food.

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, cheese, soft drinks, juice, churros, eggs, candy, doughnuts, stuffed pastries, meat, chicken, bread, fresh cheese, sausages, chocolate milk, pastries, and cookies

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La señora Victoriana R. tiene 58 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo y tiene hijos ya mayores de edad independientes económicamente. Vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio Pacú Cua de Encarnación.
La señora Victoriana se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad tales como: harina, fideos, yerbas, vinos en caja y otros, tiene muchos clientes de la zona a quienes les trae mercaderías por pedidos. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y mantener su hogar.
Por ello solicita el crédito, para poder abastecer mejor su pequeño comercio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoriana R. is 58 years old and has been married for some time. Her children are grown and financially independent. She lives in her own home in the neighborhood of Pacú Cua in Encarnación.

For some time Sra. Victoriana has been selling basic necessities such as flour, noodles, herbs, cases of wine, and other products. She has many customers in the area who want the merchandise they order delivered to them. Thanks to this business, Victoriana has been able to move forward, educate her children, and maintain her home.

She is requesting this loan so that she can better stock her small business and fulfill the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase flour, noodles, herbs, cases of wine, and other products.

loans.name: Ertrudes

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. Este cantón es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora que en su mayoría se  dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ertrudes. Ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de relación tiene un hijo de 17 años, el cual este año empieza a estudiar en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas como: gaseosas, aguas, cervezas, bebidas energizantes y batidos de frutas. También prepara y vende empanadas, hamburguesas, entre otros bocadillos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que lleva como 15 años dedicada a su negocio y que le va muy bien y además se entretiene  en el.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, aguas, cervezas, pan e ingredientes para los alimentos entre  otros productos. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) meets every fifteen days in the May 24th Canton in Manabí Province. This canton is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, and the variety of plant life. The people are friendly and hardworking. Most of them engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

It is in this place that one can find Sra. Ertrudes. She is 55 years old, married, and has a 17 year old son who is in his first year of study at the university. Her husband is a merchant.

Ertrudes is a businesswoman. She has a small bar where she sells beverages such as sodas, water, beer, energy drinks, and fruit smoothies. In addition, she prepares and sells turnovers, hamburgers, and other snacks. She works every day from 8am to 7pm. Ertrudes says that she has been in business for fifteen years and has done very well because her work keeps her busy.

This loan will be used to buy sodas, energy drinks, water, beer, bread, ingredients for preparing food, and other products. She has been a member of the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To purchase sodas, energy drinks, water, beer, bread, ingredients for preparing food, and other products.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende gaseosas, cervezas y chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar la atención de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee, 31, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank that’s located in Urcos District and is part of Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with running a bar.  She sells soft drinks, beer and chicha (a corn based beverage).  She works from 10am until 10pm.  She supports her children through this business.  She wants to improve service at the bar and is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and beer at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Botosi Plus Group

texts.en:
Botosi Plus is a Community Bank made up of 29 members whose chairwoman is Rose M.. These members are united for the same goal- to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC. 

Rose sells mushrooms, peanuts and caterpillars. She began her business in 1980. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making her business thrive thanks to her accumulated profits and different loans she received from HOPE DRC. Rose is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having obtained and correctly repaid 9 loans. She will increase her stock of her goods with her next loan by buying mushrooms, peanuts and caterpillars and reselling them at profit. Her business brings in 50 USD of profit each week. Her dream is to someday open a general store in her environment. Rose is 51 years old, widowed, and the mother of 6 children, whose ages vary between 12 and 30 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of mushrooms, peanuts and caterpillars

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
Beata is 32 years old and is single. She owns a well-organized canteen, where she sells foods such as breads, biscuits, tea, water, and juice. Her restaurant is open from 6am until 8pm every day except Saturday, and she has six years of experience. She currently employs two people to help her in her business. 

Beata has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more food and drink to sell. With any profit from this, Beata will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell, such as breads, biscuits, tea, water, juice, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells fried fish at Abura near Brasi in Cape Coast. Ama has received a junior high education. She is a widow taking care of five dependants. Ama has been selling fish for 20 years. She feeds, clothes and educates her dependants with the income she makes from her sales. A loan from Kiva will enable her to buy larger quantities of fish to fry for resale. She hopes to provide a meaningful education for her children and reinvest into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of fish

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, vive con su esposa, tiene 36 años es padre de dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, Israel es agricultor, desde joven labora en esta actividad, esta es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas de chile, abono y tratamiento para plagas, con esta oportunidad dará inicio al nuevo cultivo, del que espera sea de mucho provecho.
Su objetivo es mejorar las cosechas año con año, apoyar a sus hijos en sus necesidades básicas y formarlos en su educación.
texts.en:
Israel is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children aged 9 and 4.  He is a farmer who has been farming since he was young.  This is the source of income with which he supports his family.

Israel is requesting a loan to buy chile plants, fertilizers and pest treatments.  With the opportunity he is being given, he will start growing his new crops which he hopes will do well.

Israel's goals are to improve his harvests, year after year, and to support his children in their basic needs and also in their education.

loans.use: to buy chile plants, fertilizers and pest treatments

loans.name: Svetlana's Group

texts.en:
Svetlana, 49, is the leader of this group. She is married and has four daughters, the youngest 10 years old. Svetlana has been a farmer in her home village of Tyup for five years. Farming is a seasonal occupation for her; she also works in a local cement producing plant. Svetlana’s daughters made a big contribution of start-up capital for her business, which allowed Svetlana to purchase supplies such as potato seeds. The income from sales of her agricultural products has helped finance her daughter's wedding ceremony. Svetlana has hired field workers for help. Her other major costs include fuel and fertilizers. Svetlana believes that the requested loan will cover these costs. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El comité San Blas es de la ciudad de Asunción, actualmente cuenta con 18 miembros, todas ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y trabajo responsable. Todas trabajan para ofrecerle lo mejor a sus hijos y familiares.
La Sra. Olga se dedica a la elaboración de comestibles artesanales como ser empanadas, milanesas, y demás tipos de minutas. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha otorgado el sustento diario a su familia, dándoles una vida digna y decorosa. Sueña con algún día poder agrandar su establecimiento de comidas, y con eso generar más ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, especias, jamón, queso, y demás ingredientes que necesitaría para la elaboración de los alimentos. Sabe que este crédito le será de gran ayuda para poder continuar con sus negocios, ya que abasteciéndose puede garantizar a sus clientes sus productos.
texts.en:
The San Blas Committee is from the city of Asunción and currently has 18 members.  All of them work responsibly and in a spirit of cooperation so that they can provide the best for their children and families.  

Sra. Olga prepares homemade food such as empanadas, breaded meats, and other types of short-order dishes.  Through her work, she has been able to provide for the daily needs of her family so that they can live a decent and dignified life.  Olga dreams some day of expanding her food establishment so that she can generate more income.

She is requesting a loan to buy meats, spices, ham, cheese, and other ingredients that are needed for preparing her dishes.  Olga knows that this loan will be a great help in continuing her business.  Being fully stocked will guarantee that she can provide food to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase meats, spices, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis Miguel de veintitrés años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee una tienda que es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad; se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que necesitan, productos de muy buena calidad y a un buen precio. Luis Miguel piensa que las personas creamos nuestro propio éxito con el esfuerzo del trabajo que realizamos, y él siempre está dispuesto a salir adelante es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita surtir la tienda con productos como granos básicos, golosinas, pan, productos instantáneos, bebidas, jabón etc.; así podrá mantenerse adelante de la competencia. Luis Miguel tiene la confianza que esto le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Luis Miguel is 23 years old, and he lives with his life partner and their child. He owns a store well renowned among the people of his community: he has gained many customers because he always has what they need, his sells good quality products and charges fair prices. Luis Miguel thinks people create their own fortune by doing their jobs with determination; and as he is always keen on improving himself, he is requesting a loan to INTERGRAL in order to supply his store with products such as basic grains, candies, bread, instant products, drinks and soap, thus succeeding in remaining one step ahead of his competitors. Luis Miguel is confident that this will help him provide is family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candies, bread, instant products, drinks and soap.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 34, is married to Marselina, 28. From their marriage, they have been blessed with two children: Lady, 7, in second grade of elementary school and Yermi, 5, studying at kindergarten. 

Simon runs a kiosk business, which he started four years ago. He sells primary commodities such as sugar, coffee, bread, cooking oil, instant noodles, soap, detergent and assorted snacks and beverages. He operates his business from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. His income depends on the number of customers during the day, with more customers meaning more income. Due to the unstable income generated from the kiosk business, Simon and his wife also farm onions to earn additional income.

Simon wants to add more stock, such as rice, kerosene, petrol and snacks, to his kiosk but he needs extra capital to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. He hopes his loan application will be approved.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as rice, kerosene, petrol and snacks.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 10 children. 
Felicidad has a retail shop that sells green bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green amd yellow bananas for sale.
Felicidad is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Felicidad hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 29-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and one sibling. After graduating from the university, he opened his own pharmacy in 2010. He was eager to start his own business after noticing that there was a real need for such services in the region. He really enjoys his work, especially that he is able to help people improve their heath. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional medicines and beauty treatment products. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicines and beauty treatment products

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana, tiene cincuenta y dos  años de edad, es casada y con cuatro hijos pero solo uno se encuentra a cargo de ella.
Ana acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su casa de habitación, por lo  que este préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción como es: zinc, perlines, clavos y pintura para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentra en mal estado. 
Todo esto es para gozar de una vivienda mejor junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 52, married, and has four children but only one is still at home.

Ana went to the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to improve her house. The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as: zinc sheeting, beams, nails and paint to put on a new roof since the old one is in bad shape.

All of this is to enjoy a better home together with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: zinc, beams, nails and paint

loans.name: Gulovshe

texts.en: Gulovshe is a 46-year-old woman who is engaged in cattle breeding. She is married and has five children. Her business is the only source of income in her family. Her son helps her a lot, particularly in selling the grown animals. She usually sells growing cattle in the livestock bazaar after 5 or 6 months of raising them. Her monthly income is 150 USD. Gulovshe applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase more calves and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 29-year-old married woman but she has no child. She has a business selling bread in the Dar es Salaam branch, Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ana Cecilia; es  conviviente, la socia tiene 24 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella sigue teniendo terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa,trigo y cebada y tambien ahora tienen un carro que hace servicio de taxi,este trabajo lo realiza su esposo y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de agricultura y servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo y tambien pra el mentenimiento de su carro.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia, 24, has a spouse and two children.  She continues working in farming.  She still has farmland where she grows corn, potatoes, wheat and barley but she now also has a car that provides taxi services; her husband does this latter work and together they support their children.  She wants to expand and improve her farming and taxi businesses and is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for the fields and also to service her car.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to service her car.

loans.name: Raghada

texts.en:
Raghda is an 18-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Raghda is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Raghda is looking to improving her family's living conditions.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Raghda's husband.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia, de 30 años es una mujer valiente. Vive en compañía de Rolando, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos menores, a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Huaytacorral. Ella conformó su familia con muchas limitaciones, vive en una casa pequeña, donde comparte su dormitorio con la cocina en un mismo lugar. Por ello espera ahorrar, para construir el resto de su casa, con muchos cuartos donde pueda cada uno tener su sitio. Sabe que lo conseguirá con su principal actividad económica, “la agricultura”. Sus cultivos son papa y maca; los cuales cuida en sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos productivos, que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo, pues tenía que trabajar durante horas e incluso días de esmero para sacar una buena cosecha. Pero no solo a ello se dedica, también cría animales como vacas, cerdos, ovejas y caballos para carga, los cuales vende a buen precio después de ensebarlos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Eusebia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la construcción de un cuarto para instalar su cocina.
texts.en:
Eusebia, age 30, is a courageous woman.  She lives with Rolando, her husband of eight years.  They have four minor children that they are raising and educating in their own house.  They live in the rural community of Huaytacorral.  She has adapted her family to many limitations.  She lives in a small house where she shares her bedroom with the kitchen, which is in the same place.

She hopes to save in order to build the rest of her house with lots of rooms where each one of them can have their place.  She knows that she will succeed with her main financial activity, agriculture.  Her crops are potatoes and maca (a peruvian root grown for its nutritional and medicinal value).  She takes care of her crops on four hectares of productive land, which she obtained through much effort.  She had to work carefully during hours and even days in order to get a good harvest.  

However, that is not the only thing she does.  She also raises animals like cows, pigs, sheep, and packhorses.  She sells them for a good price after fattening them.  

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She hopes to have your collaboration in order to be able to solidify her plans.  She pledges to make her payments.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to build a room to set up her kitchen.

loans.use: to build a room for her kitchen.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with five children. 

Rodrigo has a shop that sells electronic phone loads from several networks. He is also engaged in a networking business called UNIGOSYO. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

Rodrigo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

loans.name: G.s. Los Coquitos Group

texts.es: Ery  Neftalí y Paz Catalina conforman el grupo solidario Los Coquitos.  Ery se dedica a la venta de ropa y brindar el servicio de triciclo, desde hace mas de 13 años el tiene este medio de vida y al mismo tiempo se ha hecho cargo de sus 5 hijos con las siguientes edades 22, 11, 24, 23 y 19 años. El necesita incrementar su capital de trabajo con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de capital trabajo como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, entre otro tipo de ropa.
texts.en:
Ery Neftali and Paz Catalina belong to the “Los Coquitos” solidarity group. Ery sells clothing and offers tricycle transport services. For more than 13 years he has made his living in this manner and, at the same time, has taken care of his 5 children, aged 24, 23, 22, 19, and 11. 

He needs to increase his working capital in order to satisfy current customer demand. The motive for the loan is to buy merchandise, including pants, shirts, skirts, and suits, among other types of clothing.

loans.use: purchase pants, shirts, skirts, and suits, among other types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Omankul

texts.ru: Оманкул кредитуется в организации с 2007 года, ему 41 год, он отец четверых детей. Жена занимается воспитанием детей и производством пряжи и вязанием носков. Он занимается с детства откормом скота вместе с отцом. Но после смерти папы Оманкул самостоятельно продолжает эту деятельность.Сейчас у него несколько десятков коз и баранов, но для закупа ещё несколько голов скота он решил получить очередной кредит, так как сейчас подешевел скот на рынке. Он пунктуальный и ответственный мужчина.
texts.en: Omankul has been obtaining financing from the organization since 2007.  He is 41 years old and is a father of four children.  His wife is involved in raising the children, processing yarn and knitting socks.  Omankul has been involved in fattening up livestock together with his father since childhood, but, since his father's death, Omankul has been running this business independently.  Currently, he has several dozen of goats and sheep, but decided to obtain his next loan to purchase additional livestock because livestock prices dropped at the market.  Omankul is a punctual and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, amable y le gusta el negocio. Esta separada de su pareja pero vive con su hijo de 12 años de edad, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de suplementos nutricionales, negocio que se inició hace un año y por medio de una amiga que le dio la oportunidad e integrar a éste trabajo. Ahora  ella misma trae desde la ciudad de Lima la mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, quienes previamente le hacen el pedido. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones como el ayudar a muchas personas en el cuidado de su salud, también en su ingreso económico y el sentirse una empresaria que cada día más. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de productos nutricionales y medicinales en mayor volumen de estos productos y a menor costo, desea comprar la mayor variedad posible, de esa manera apoyar en el tratamiento de enfermedades de muchas personas.
texts.en:
Diana, 42, is a hard-working and kind woman who likes business.  She is separated from her partner but lives with her 12-year-old son in a house that is her property.  The work she does is selling nutritional supplements, a business she started a year ago through a friend who gave her the opportunity to join this business.  Now she herself brings the merchandise from the city of Lima to satisfy the demand of her customers, who order from her in advance.

She likes her job because it has brought her great satisfaction, such as helping a lot of people in their health care, in addition to her economic income and feeling like a business woman more every day.  This will be her first loan with the MFP institution, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.

With the requested loan of 800 PEN she will invest in buying nutritional and medicinal products wholesale and at a lower price.  She wants to buy the greatest variety possible so she can help treat the illnesses of many people.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса замужем, имеет двоих детей. Двадцать лет назад она начала свой бизнес – выращивание ранних овощей в теплицах. Она выращивает помидоры, огурцы и баклажаны. Лариса любит свое дело и хочет развивать его дальше.

Для того, чтобы успешно начать этот сезон Ларисе нужно закупить семена, пленку для теплиц, дрова для отопления и металлические дуги для текущего ремонта теплиц. Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен.
texts.en: Larisa is married and has two children.  She started her business of growing early vegetables in greenhouses twenty years ago.  She grows tomatoes, cucumbers and eggplants.  Larisa loves her business and wants to grow it further.  In order to begin this season successfully, she needs to purchase seeds, plastic for greenhouses, firewood for heating and metal frames for the ongoing greenhouses repair.  Larisa is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and materials for greenhouses

loans.name: Guadalupe Antonio

texts.es: El señor Guadalupe Antonio está casado, a pesar de que es muy joven siempre ha pensado en el bienestar de su futura familia, hace unos años el compro un terreno ir formando su patrimonio, primero pidió un préstamo en esta institución para construir un cuarto pequeño el cual ya tiene levantado, pero quiere nuevamente un préstamo para construir el baño y así tener los servicios necesario para habitarla sin ningún problema. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra. Para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar el trabaja en un imprenta, de esta manera el ofrece su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antonio is married.  Even though he is very young, he has thought about the wellbeing of his future family.  A few years ago, he bought a plot of land and made his home.  He first asked for a loan from this institution to build a small room, which he has already built.  He wants a new loan to build a bathroom, and therefore have the necessary services to live in his home without a problem.  To be able to complete his project, he needs to buy construction materials and pay for labor.  To be able to cover the household costs, he work at a printing press.  This way, he offers his family a better way of life.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yvonne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Yvonne est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Yvonne vend depuis dix ans des savons, du riz, des condiments et du charbon de bois. Yvonne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Yvonne ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONKPO sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons, du riz, des condiments et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim lives in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school. To support her big family, she has been farming rice while her husband produces palm juice. The current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 20,000KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield has been still a challenge for her business. 

This is Sokhim’s first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has used the past loans to better support the family. And right now she is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a living better and afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
A. Grace is an active member of Life in Africa working as a bracelet maker in the invisible children bracelet project. She lives with her husband and child in the IDP camp know as the Acholi quarters. Her husband works as a carpenter.

They, like so many other families, had to flee their home in Gulu because of the war. They find life in the camp difficult. They are able to earn enough for the basic needs but they know that they would be much better off if they could eliminate the rent which is one of the biggest expenses.

They have acquired a plot of land from the king of Buganda who donated free land to the Acholi. Here A. and her husband plan to build a two roomed house and, once it is done, this will free up a good part of their income to be used for other purposes such as food and helping their relatives. The husband is a carpenter and is able to mobilize his colleagues to help in the construction thereby saving the labor costs.

For this project she is seeking a loan in the amount of 700,000/= that she will repay in 12 months at a rate of 58,333/= per month.

Below is her break down:

-99 poles both for the wall and the roof @ 2000 each = 198,000/=

-18 iron sheets ‘gauge 23’ @ 10,000/ = 180,000/=

-4 bags of cement @ 72,000/=

-water to be used in the construction =30,000/=

-transport =30,000/=

-sand 1 trip= 50,000/=

-2 wooden doors @ 50,000 =100000/=

-2 woodenwindows @ 20,000/= 40,000/=

Total=700,000/=

Grace's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her peers at the Life in Africa WE Center community in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Life in Africa's Adult Education program. For more about Grace, her life and her worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/graceA.

loans.use: Family house

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos has 5 years of experience in his store. Previously he worked selling vegetables at outdoor fairs but he had to stop because of problems with the city. Later he and his wife decided to start a food sales business. On his own initiative he decided to sell the chairs and tables that he had to raise financing, and began to buy stock for his food store. At the moment he rents space close to his home, He works every day of the week from 7 am to 10 pm.

Carlos wants the loan in order to be able to expand his business with products he doesn’t currently offer. He is confident that with this investment he will successfully increase his earnings.

Carlos is 63 years old. He is married and has an adult son who helps him with what he needs. His son lives with Carlos and his wife. In the future he hopes to improve his house and to be able to fix up a place in his home for his business, to save what his is spending on rent.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos tiene una experiencia de 5 años con el negocio de la tienda. Anterior a esta el se dedicaba a la venta de legumbres en las ferias libres pero por el municipio que los molestaba tuvo que dejar esa actividad. Luego de esto decide junto a su esposa poner un negocio de venta de comida. Por su iniciativa decide vender las sillas y mesas que tenia y logra financiarse para poder comenzar a comprar víveres para su tienda. Al momento arrienda el local cerca de su domicilio, la trabaja todos los días de la semana en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. Carlos desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con productos que no tiene y esta seguro que con dicha inversión lograra tener más ganancias. Carlos tiene 63 años, es casado y tiene un hijo el cual ya es adulto y le ayuda en lo que necesitan, su hijo ya tiene compromiso y vive con ellos. A futuro espera mejorar su domicilio y poder adecuar un lugar en el para poner su negocio y no estar pagando arriendo por el mismo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sayed Jalal-U-Din

texts.en: Sayed Jalal-U-Din S/O Sayed Jamal-u-Din was born in 1972 and lives in District 8 of Kabul City. He is married and has six family members. He Runs a Grocery and Ice Cream shop in District 8. He Started  his business with the Ice Cream Shop and with some his income, he was able to start a Grocery Shop as well. But it was difficult to keep going, because he didn't have the funds he needed to run the business properly. Than he heard about the AFSG's loan process from one of his friends and decided to participate in that program. Through his 1st loan cycle he purchased more grocery items, and this increased the number of his customers. Now he has finished his 4th cycle loan and is in his 5th cycle. "The loans really helped me establish my business. I am really happy with it and will continue taking loans in the future." says Sayed Jalal-U-Din. He is grateful for the opportunity to make a good business.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, ghee, flour and other grocery items

loans.name: Zarmena

texts.en: Zarmena lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and lives with her children. She supports her family as an embroiderer and she has 10 years of experience. She has 3 students. She took her 1st cycle group loan and changed her machines and worked hard and made a good monthly income. She wants to take anther loan to change the machines of her students to expand her business. She is happy that she can help her family.

loans.use: To change the machines

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero S. sells fruit to those living in her community and neighboring town. She is 40 years old, and married with 5 children.  She hails from Uromi town in Edo State and has been in this business since 1982.  She needs $400 to enable her to buy more fruit like pawpaw, pears, etc. to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto is a married man whose wife stays at home. He is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business three years ago. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well, and which he would like to continue to grow.

Roberto is requesting a loan for $650 for the purchase of cattle to sell; he will reinvest the capital and grow the business as he has been doing. He is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Roberto es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que inició su negocio en paralelo al trabajo que tenía, como un ingreso adicional y para ir juntando algo de capital como reserva por si se quedaba desempleado, conocía muchos contactos que compraban ganado y eso lo motivo a iniciar su negocio. Empezó hace tres años atrás y con el paso del tiempo ha ido creciendo con sus ventas y ahora necesita apoyo para invertir en su negocio, ya que le ha ido bien y desea continuar creciendo con el mismo.

Roberto esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 650 para la compra de ganado para luego venderlo y reinvertir sus utilidades en el mismo negocio y crecer como lo ha ido haciendo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar con su negocio y crecer para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for resale

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngozi A. is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Ngozi sells clothes. This is a business she started in 2006. She is in need of a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucrecia P. is a married woman who lives in a solid home, result of of the hard work of both her and her husband. Mrs. P. has had the fortune that her daughters are studying in college, all thanks to their effort and daily hard work. Her business is buying household items both in cash and on credit, depending on the season.

She has had this business for 20 years, starting with a sum of C$1,000.00 from her own savings.

It all started when Mrs. P., having seen the need for her children to keep going, decided to buy these products and set up herself in a street corner in some cardboard stands. Later she got better established, acquiring a stand in a location with high traffic, attended by a variety of customers, located downtown by the main street. The only inconvenient of this space is that it is very small, so she has to place some of her merchandise on the sidewalk and be careful her products are not lost.

Currently, Mrs. P. has been working with Ceprodel for three years as her best aide in helping her business grow through 26 loans. These loans have had an impact in the expansion of her business, allowing her to acquire more merchandise to support her daughter's studies in college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lucrecia Pérez es una dama casada que vive en un hogar bien solidó producto de la lucha que tienen ambos conyugues para sobrevivir. La señora Pérez ha tenido el privilegio de que una de sus hijas este cursando la universidad y todo gracias a su esfuerzo y lucha en la labor de cada día. El negocio que tiene es la compra a proveedores de contado y al crédito de utensilios del hogar que van dependiendo de la época o temporada.

Tiene 20 años de tener su negocio y lo inició con un monto de C$1.000.00 producto del ahorro personal.

Todo comenzó cuando la señora Pérez al ver la necesidad de que sus hijos debían de salir adelante, decidió adquirir estos productos y colocarse en la esquina de una calle en casetas de cartón, posteriormente se fue ubicando mejor teniendo un puesto donde fluyen variedad de clientes ubicada en el centro Metropolitano a orilla de la calle principal en uno de sus módulos. El único inconveniente que tiene es el espacio del modulo que es bastante pequeño por lo que tiene que sacar mercadería a la acera teniendo el cuidado que no se le extravíen sus productos.

La señora Pérez hoy en día con Ceprodel tiene tres años de estar trabajando siendo su mejor aliado en el crecimiento de su negocio con 26 créditos otorgados que han tenido impacto en la ampliación de su negocio obteniendo mayor mercadería para así avanzar con los estudios de su hija que cursa la universidad.

loans.use: Buying utensils, household items (Compra de utensilios)

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Martha was born in Managua, and she works as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes in the neighborhood of her local district or in the “Zona Franca”. She has been in this line of business for 5 years and she requires a loan in order to increase her stock as she wishes to buy garments and shoes fit for school uniforms to offer to her clients as the school year is about to start.

She has two children, a 24 year-old daughter and a 17 year-old son who look after her home while she is working. She wishes to grow economically so she can count on a stable and prosperous business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Martha es originaria de Managua, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, su forma de trabajo es ambulante, ya sea en los alrededores de su barrio o en la Zona Franca.Tiene 5 años de estar en este negocio, necesita el crédito porque quiere aumentar su mercadería comprando ropa y zapatos escolares y poder colocarlos entre sus clientes, aprovechando que la época escolar ya está por entrar.

Tiene dos hijos, una mujer de 24 años y un varón de 17 años, quienes se encargan del cuidado del hogar cuando ella está trabajando. Espera poder crecer económicamente y en un futuro contar con un negocio próspero y estable.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes fit for school uniforms in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Santos Gerardo

texts.es:
Don Santos is 38 years of age and lives with his family in San Caralampio. He is dedicated to agriculture, having 20 years of experience at this activity. He has sown coffee, chayote and banana; products in high demand since they are part of the diet of the Nicaraguans. A part of his crop is destined for personal use and the majority he sells in the different markets of Managua and Ticuantepe. The income that he generates with this activity vary, depending on the season in which the product is harvested. That is why his wife supports him in paying the household expenses. She is dedicated to the sale of food products. The economic situation of the country has affected the acquisition of the supplies for productive work. The costs of fertilizers, supplements and insecticides have been increased to the point where he needs a loan to be able to buy them. They fear to lose the crop that they possess at this time, due to the lack of these supplies.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Santos tiene 38 años de edad, habita con su familia en San Caralampio, se dedica a la agricultura, posee 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, tiene sembrado café, chayote y plátano; productos bien demandados, ya que son parte de la alimentación de los nicaragüenses, una parte se destina para el autoconsumo y la mayoría la comercializa en los diferentes mercados de Managua y Ticuantepe. Los ingresos que genera esta actividad varían, depende de la temporada en que el producto se coseche, es por eso que la esposa lo apoya en los gastos de la casa, se dedica al comercio de productos alimenticios. La situación económica del país, ha afectado la adquisición de los insumos de trabajo productivos, ya que los costos de fertilizantes, abonos e insecticidas se han incrementado, por lo cual necesita de un préstamo para poder comprarlos, ya que temen perder la cosecha que poseen en estos momentos, debido a la falta de estos insumos.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, supplements and insecticides.

loans.name: Gidin

texts.id:
Giding is a used goods collector who collects used goods to be resold to recycle depot. He usually walks up to 2 km per day to collect the used goods, mainly the ones made of plastic, aluminum, iron and glass such as bottles. He can earn up to IDR 800 thousand (around USD 100) per month from this work, which he uses to pay for his rent, daily necessities and even to be saved for some.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Gidin adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Gidin harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Gidin mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods (Modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Alime

texts.en:
Alime has a small business selling women’s clothing at the bustling Central market in Simferopol, Ukraine. She sells a selection of day-to-day wear as well as dressy clothes. Alime is single and has been in business for four years. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this is times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. Alime has expanded her business by opening a second sales kiosk and is thinking of opening a third kiosk in the future.

Alime has requested a short term loan to help renew her supply of clothing inventory. The change of seasons means a busy time of year for clothing vendors like Alime. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: Alime would like to renew her supply of inventory for her women's clothing stall.

loans.name: Soe

texts.en:
Soe R. is 29-years-old. She runs a popular Khmer business selling sugar cane juice. Sellers typically have a small cart with a crank operated grinder which grinds the juice out of stalks of sugar cane. They then serve the juice often over ice in bags tied at the end with straws stuck in them. Her earnings are rather meager at only one dollar per day.

Her husband’s business has not been very successful either, earning only $1.50 per day as a motor-taxi driver. On these small wages they support three children. She hopes to take out a loan to buy more sugar cane as well as a supply of grocery products she can sell from her cart to attract more business. (Her husband is pictured here as she was unavailable to be photographed.)

loans.use: To buy grocery products and sugar cane.

loans.name: Jackeli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jakeli Gonzáles sells clothing in her own home, which is located in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She is a lady who has made great efforts to maintain her home and to guard the well-being of her family.

It is necessary for Jackeli to invest in merchandise for her business; growing competition necessitates that she offer more clothing to keep clients. For this reason, she has sought the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan that would permit her to buy more merchandise. Today, her credit record is perfect, given that she has repaid all loans obtained through the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jakeli Gonzáles se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama muy esforzada que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al trabajo para mantener su hogar y hoy en día velar por el bienestar de su familia.

Actualmente el negocio de la señora Jakeli atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en mercadería ya que al crecer su competencia le es necesario a ella también ofertar mas ropa para acaparar a los clientes. Por esta razón es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para su negocio. Hoy en día su record crediticio se encuentra en perfectas condiciones ya que ha cancelado satisfactoriamente todos los créditos con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37-years-old and a widow. She has three children who are currently in school.

To support her household, Gloria has been selling soft drinks and meat pie in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling soft drinks is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory, which will enable her to make better income to meet her family’s needs.

Gloria is a member of the group called “Enka ho daa” (It shall come to pass). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of soft drinks.

loans.name: Ablayo

texts.fr: Née en 1952, Madame G. Ablayo  est une commerçante de poissons dans le milieu. Une activité qui est très rentable dans la zone .Mariée elle a en charge trois (3) enfants. Avec l’aide de son mari, elle fait des achats de poisson pour les revendre à agomé. Vue l’augmentation de la demande et manquant de fonds nécessaires pour faire face à cette situation, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit qui va lui servir d’approvisionner  toute la zone en poisson et en grande quantité.
texts.en:
Born in 1952, Mrs. Ablayo G. is a fishmonger in her neighborhood. That's a business that is very profitable where she lives. She is married and responsible for 3 children. With the help of her husband, she buys fish to re-sell in Agomé. In view of the rising demand for her product and lacking the necessary funds to cope with this situation, she is requesting a new loan which will allow her to supply all the neighborhood in fish in large quantities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of fish

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mr. Kheng S. was born in 1974 and he now lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. He is an ice-cream seller who can make only a meager income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Net Savy, is a farmer who now faces an obstacle in planting her fields because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field.

In order to solve this problem, Mr. Kheng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more ox to add to the one he already has in order to plow the rice field. Mr. Kheng S. is 34 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Mr. Kheng S.'s wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more one more ox in order to plow the rice field

loans.name: Hidelsa

texts.es:
La señora Hidelsa, socia del Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, vive en la Región  San Martín,  provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y algunos repuestos para carros en vista que su casa esta cerca de un taller para este tipo de vehículos. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en la Carretera Marginal Km. 01. Se inicia en el negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, sobretodo los gastos escolares.  

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará agua mineral, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y de tamaño personal, mediano y familiar, así como también adquirirá repuestos y accesorios que más solicitan sus clientes, además de aceite para vehículos.

Hidelsa tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 02 de sus hijos que aún están a su cargo. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Más adelante desea terminar de construir sus habitaciones para poder alquilar a estudiantes porque vive al costado de la universidad, así como también quiere construir un kiosco al frente de su casa para vender refrigerios.
texts.en:
Hidelsa is a member of the Communal Bank “The Hope”. She lives in the San Martin region province of Mariscal Caceres district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sale of refreshments, and repair supplies for cars to supply the commuters that drive through her area every day to the local factories. The business is located on the side of the main highway. She began this business because she needed to generate more income to compensate for the increase in expenses for her children, especially their studies. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will buy bottled water and soda, and repair supplies and high demand accessories for cars. Hidelsa is 41 and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is a very perseverant and responsible person with a large ambition to help her kids get ahead. She hopes to finish the construction of two rooms in her home in order to rent them out to students at the university. She also has the idea of open a kiosk in from of her home to sell refrigerated goods.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottled water and soda, and repair supplies and high demand accessories for cars

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa D. est propriétaire d’un bar restaurant depuis 7 ans à Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Agée de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité et achetant des matières première nécessaire à la restauration du « foufou » un plat conçu à base de l’igname et qui est tant appréciée par la population locale.
texts.en:
Yawa D. has owned a bar-restaurant for 7 years in Atakpamé, a city in the centre of Togo. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She hopes to increase the capacity of her business by buying the raw materials necessary for the production of "foufou", a yam-based dish very much appreciated by the locals.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams for her restaurant

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
Rosa A. is a part of a large group of women named "Paz y Amor" which means Peace and Love. She and her whole group are living in extreme poverty, and almost all of them have no form of steady income.
