Rosa is a mother to 3 children, and has to take care of them all by herself without a husband. She is so excited about the idea of starting her own business, and needs this to help provide for her 3 children. She plans on starting a small business selling fruits and vegetables in her area.

She hopes to have a thriving grocery store someday, and to save enough to send her children to college. She said she wants nothing more than for her children to have a better life than she has had, and said she is willing to do anything to give that to them. She said she feels that having her own business is the first step to reaching her goals, and she is ready for this challenge!

loans.use: Purchasing products for her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, socia del B. C “Mujeres Emprendedoras”,  vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes en general y bebidas gasificadas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa a donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2 000.00  nuevos soles que pagará en 06 meses comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y demás productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisface las necesidades de sus clientes.

La señora Marina,  tiene 42 años de edad,  vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo quien se dedica a trabajos eventuales, esta agradecida con el apoyo brindado por que le permite crecer en su negocio, su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Marina, a member of the “Enterprising Women” cooperative bank, lives in the San Martín region of the Moyobamba district. She dedicates herself to selling groceries and soft drinks. Her business is located in her own home, where her customers go every day. With this loan of 2,000.00 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in six months, she will purchase basic products such as rice, sugar by the sack, various brand detergents, canned goods, boxed milk, and personal hygiene products that she needs to supply her business and satisfy her customers’ needs. Marina is 42 years old and lives with her three children, as well as her husband who dedicates himself to temporary jobs. She is thankful for the support provided, as it allows her to grow her business. Her goals are to expand her enterprise and to purchase her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic necessities such as rice, sugar by the sack, various brand detergents, canned goods, milk, personal hygiene products, and also products to supply her store and satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yankadi (composé de 6 femmes  mariées) ont en moyenne  32 ans et  3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Hamdalaye de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent les activités commerciales : la vente de légume, du savon, de l’arachide ; du sucre et du sucre. 
Pour mener à bien leur activité et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été bien dénoué.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de 50kg de légume, 5 sacs de 100 kg de sucre, 10 charrettes de bois de chauffe et 15 sacs de 10kg d’arachides. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et dans  les villages environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et la plupart au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utilisent pour soutenir un peu la famille en aidant leur mari et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Yankadi (composed of 6 married women) have an average age of 32 with, on average, 3 children. They reside in the Hamdalaye neighborhood of the town of Sikasso.

They are engaged in commercial activities: selling vegetables, soap, peanuts, and sugar. In order to have their businesses succeed and satisfy the needs of their clientele, they collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was repaid in a timely manner.

They intend to use this loan to buy 10 sacks of 50 kg of vegetables, 5 sacks of 100 kg of sugar, 10 wagonloads of firewood, and 15 sacks of 10 kg of peanuts. They buy their goods right in Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and in the surrounding villages.

The products are sold retail and mostly for cash, in the markets of the town of Sikasso (Médine and the big open-air market of the town) and out of their own homes to a clientele composed of women and men.

They each hope to make an average profit of 15,000 F CFA per month which they will use to help their husbands out a little bit in supporting their families, while investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for their businesses

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en:
Mamurjon is a 32-year-old young man with a wife and three children. He dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on the two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally. He rents the microbus.  Mamurjon has about two years of experience in the public transportation field. The competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it. He is requesting a loan of  600 USD for the term of 6 months. His  request is so that he can maintain his vehicles. With the loan he’ll purchase  spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Mamurjon will continue to progress. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Tp purchase  spare parts  to repair his microbus

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
La señora Lleny M. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Los Andes Nº 591, Distrito de Morales, departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, pedido por sus clientes de acuerdo al catálogo.
  
Con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas caballeros y niños, desodorantes, esmaltes, lociones y así  tener en stock sus productos para venderlos a  precio de catálogo  generándole una mayor ganancia.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Lleny, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lleny M. V. belongs to the “Las Moralinas” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Los Andes Nº 591, Morales district, San Martín department. She is married, 36 years old, and is the mother of 2 children. Today she sells cosmetics, which her customers order by catalog. With the loan for S/2,500.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy beauty products on sale such as perfume for women, men and children, deodorant, nail polish, lotions, and in this way have in stock products to sell them at the catalog prices, generating greater profits. She is the one who makes the decisions regarding the income from her business, is assured in offering her products, and she considers herself a hard-working woman, constant and responsible with her loan payments. Lleny thanks Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, deoderants, lotions, nail polish

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua G. is 30 years old. She is a divorced mother of five children. Akua says her children are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools.

She works to make income to take care of the family, since she gets support from no where else. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader. She deals in second hand textiles such as bed sheets, shirts, shorts, pants, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to villages to sell. Akua has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles. She is hopeful to improve her living standard and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: Procure second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maisa

texts.es: Maisa tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la ayudaron para salir adelante. Aunque es muy joven, se siente en la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, tiene actualmente un restaurante en la casa de ellos, el cual ella misma atiende y administra, su establecimiento es uno de los más concurridos de su barrio, puesto que tiene una muy buena sazón. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, pero le es muy difícil atender ella sola a todos sus clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro su restaurante pueda crecer más y le genere mejores ingresos, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el tercer préstamo de Maisa con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos espera pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se lleguen en las reuniones. Con el dinero solicitado planea mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante y comprar más ingredientes para cocinar.
texts.en:
Maisa is 23 years old, is a hardworking young woman and lives with her parents, who always help her to move forward. Even though she is very young, she feels responsible in helping her parents with family expenses. She has a restaurant in their house, which is managed and run by Maisa herself. Her restaurant is one of the busiest in her neighborhood because she has very good seasonings. What she likes most about her job is cooking, but it is very difficult to attend to her customers on her own. She has been doing this for 3 years and she hopes that, in the future, her restaurant can grow more and generate greater earnings. She knows that to reach her goals she must work a lot and she is ready to do so. This is Maisa's third loan with MFP. Like her first loans, she hopes to pay this loan back on time. With the requested money she plans to improve the environment of her restaurant and buy more ingredients for cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving the environment of her restaurant and buying supplies

loans.name: Kuna Guapa Group

texts.es:
El inicio del presente comité fue la señora Angelina E. quien se informo  del programa, invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La srta. María Leticia E. se dedica a la artesanía  de sombreros de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo de esa manera obtener mayor comodidad y mas producción.

La Sra. Yolanda Beatriz O. se dedica a la artesanía en cueros, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo logrando así mayor productividad.

La Sra. María Lys Martínez se dedica a la venta de lencería en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías al por mayor pudiendo de ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La Sra. Angelina E. tiene una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su negocio.

La Sra. Mirtha Liliana A. es costurera, invirtió su dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo tijera telas, hilos, etc.

La Sra. Pastora P. tiene una cantina en una escuela de su barrio, invirtió el dinero en la compra de  mercadería en general para surtir su negocio.

La Sra. Elva D.  se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para la elaboración de los comestibles de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de comestible a su clientela.

La Sra. María Cristina P. es costurera,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo pudiendo de ese modo obtener mayor productividad.

La Sra. Cecilia B. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La Sra.Vicenta  A. se dedica a la venta de frutas,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de frutas al por mayor para luego venderlas y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad.

La Sra. Eusebia C. es modista, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo logrando así mayor eficacia y calidad en sus prendas. 

La Sra. Zunilda Elizabeth Rodríguez es artesana en sombrero de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo.

La Sra. Fabiana Centurión es comerciante, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general de esa manera surtir su negocio ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La Sra. Marcelina R. se dedica a la venta de prendas,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas en general logrando así surtir sus mercaderías y ofrecer mayor variedad a su clientela.

La Sra. Sonia Giménez  se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería, invirtió el  dinero en la compra de artículos de mercería en general obteniendo más variedad de mercaderías que ofrecer a sus  clientes.

 La Sra. Elena M. es artesana e sombreros de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo.

La Sra. Francisca O. se dedica a  la venta de carbón, invirtió el dinero en la compra de carbón en cantidad para luego venderlos y obtener una buena ganancia.

La Sra.Mirta González se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los productos.

La Sra. Elvia E. se dedica a realizar manualidades, cotillón para acontecimientos en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo.
texts.en:
The present committee was started by Mrs. Angelina E. who gathered information on the program, invited and organized her friends to form part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. Miss Maria Leticia E. makes hats from karanday. She invested the money in the purchase of tools for her work and in this way be more comfortable and have greater output. Mrs. Yoanda Beatriz O. does leatherwork. She invested the money in tools for her work, in order to achieve greater productivity. Mrs. María Lys Martinez sells lingerie. She invested the money in the purchase of wholesale merchandise in order to be able to offer greater selection to her customers. Mrs. Angelina E. has a small grocery store. She invested the money in the purchase of merchandise for her business. Mrs. Mirtha Liliana A. is a seamstress. She invested her money in the purchase of tools for her work such as scissors, fabrics, threads, etc. Mrs. Pastora P. has a cantina in a school in the neighborhood. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise to stock her business. Mrs. Elva D. sells prepared food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make food and in this way be able to offer greater variety to her customers. Mrs. María Cristina P. is a seamstress. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her work, enabling her to increase her productivity. Mrs. Cecilia B. sells prepared food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients for making the items she sells. Mrs. Vicenta A. sells fruit. She invested the money in the wholesale purchase of fruit so that she can sell it and offer her customers greater variety. Mrs. Eusebia C. is a dressmaker. She invested the money in the purchase of tools for her work, in order to achieve better efficiency and quality in her garments. Mrs. Zunilda Elizabeth Rodríguez is an artisan who makes hats from karanday. She invested the money in the purchase of items for her work. Mrs. Fabiana Centurión is a shop owner. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise to stock her business and provide greater selection to her customers. Mrs. Marcelina R. sells clothing. She invested the money in the purchase of clothing, stocking up o merchandise and offering better selection to her customers. Mrs. Sonia Giménez sells hardware. She invested the money in the purchase of general hardware to have a greater selection to offer her customers. Mrs. Elena M. is an artisan who makes hats from karanday. She invested the money in the purchase of items for her work. Mrs. Francisca O. sells charcoal. She invested the money in the purchase of charcoal in quantity, so that it can be sold for a good profit. Mrs. Mirta González sells cleaning products. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her products. Mrs. Elvia E. creates crafts and decorations for events. She invested the money in the purchase of items for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, fabric, karanday, drinks, meat, sausages, corn, bread, herbs, oil, sweets, vegetables, fruit, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Mirium

texts.en:
For many years, Mirium has been running a tailoring business in the Nzovwe neighborhood. She makes different types of dresses and sells them. She currently earns a little amount of monthly profit. She works at her business for 12 hours every day. Mirium is 32 years old, married, and has two children: ages 9 and 6. She also cares for one dependent.

Mirium is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. She belongs to Majengo B1 Group loan (Group code 2016).

loans.use: To buy more items for a tailoring business

loans.name: Fama Dieng

texts.fr: fama dieng D. est une femme mariée et a trois enfants en charge;elle fait du commerce de poissons depuis plus de dix ans ;c'est dans le but de satisfaire sa clientèle qu'il sollicite ce pret pour aussi améliorer ses revenus
texts.en:
Fama Dieng D. is a married woman with 3 children. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years. She is asking for this loan to satisfy the needs of her clientele and also to increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling fish

loans.name: Leaosavaii

texts.en: Leaosavaii S., 28, is single with no children.  She has many years of experience in the mower business.  She sells to the general public 2 days per week.  She has 5 previous loans with SPBD.  Leaosavaii expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Leaosavaii’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase mower supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 54years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 66 years old. Florencia is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Florencia owns & operates a pedicab transport service. Florencia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Florencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a secondhand pedicab. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand pedicab

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo Alfonso de 39, quien es comerciante, y con sus hijos Miriam de 17 y Yordi de 9 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda, la cual puso a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Debido a que su esposo también es comerciante, ahora entre los dos pueden generar muchos más ingresos para el bien de su familia. A Rosmery le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que lo realiza desde su casa y puede distribuir su tiempo entre las labores del hogar, el cuidado de sus hijos y la atención a su negocio. Por otro lado, su tienda le resulta muy rentable, ya que abre desde tempranas horas y cierra ya entrada la noche, por eso ella quiere seguir mejorando su negocio expandiendo su espacio y abasteciéndolo con más productos para captar más clientela. Lamentablemente algunas veces el permanecer durante todo el día le resulta muy cansado, pero felizmente sus hijos la ayudan, ocasionalmente, con la atención y así ella pueda salir a adquirir más productos para aumentar su mercadería. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosmery en su banco comunal con MFP, ella y sus compañeras son muy  puntuales en los pagos. Pero no fue siempre así, ya que al inicio tuvieron compañeras que fallaron en algunos pagos, sin embargo ahora sólo quedaron las más responsables. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar golosinas para abarcar el segmento infantil, que lo había dejado un poco olvidado y así tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 39 años, es madre de 3 hijos que están siguiendo estudios superiores y también trabajan, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador de la municipalidad de su localidad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo. Vilma compra diariamente 20 pollos, posteriormente ella misma los mata y limpia para venderlos por los distintos lugares de su zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas, por ello da un buen trato a todos sus clientes para que le compren regularmente y la recomienden. Por otro parte, este negocio logra que Vilma se sienta útil y un sostén de su familia, apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su deseo a futuro es lograr implementar un pequeño minimarket donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de productos a sus vecinos y clientes.
Con MFP, este sería su 6to préstamo, es parte de un banco comunal y lo que más le gusta de esta metodología de trabajo es que entre todos los integrantes se apoyan y trabajan responsablemente para el puntual pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará un triciclo para movilizar su producto. También adquirirá pollos bebés y suficiente alimento para su alimentación, puesto que ha decidido dejar de comprarlos y criar sus propios pollos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and is the mother of 3 children who are in college and also work. She lives with her husband who is a city worker in their town. For the last 3 years, she has sold meat and chicken. Each day, Vilma buys 20 chickens, then butchers and cleans them so that she can sell them in different locations in her area. What she most enjoys about her work is connecting with many different people and providing good customer service so that they keep coming back and recommending her to others. Also, her business makes Vilma feel useful and supports her family, helping her husband with household expenses. Her hope for the future is to open a minimarket where she can offer a wide variety of products to her neighbors and customers. This will be her sixth loan with MFP as part of a Village Bank. What she likes the most about this method is that all of the participants support each other and work responsibly to pay back their loans on time. With the money from the loan she is requesting she will buy a tricycle to transport her products. She will also buy baby chicks and enough feed for them as she has decided to stop buying and to raise her own chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a tricycle, chickens and chickenfeed

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is divorced and has one son. She owns a small business and sells clothing at central market in Novomoskovsk. Irina has been in this business for 15 years. She has always offered high quality products and client service. Today she has got many repeated clients and a stable business. Irina has active life position that encourages the business neighbors and friends. Irina would like to borrow 16,400 UAH to increase the inventories. She hopes to increase the sales and received additional income.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice G. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of sugar for tea. Joice is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of sugar.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: M. Marie est née en 1974 à Djèrègbé, village situé à l’entrée de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Marie réside à Gbokpa à Djèrègbé depuis une douzaine d'année. Mariée à DOSSOU Avocèfohoun, un maçon, Marie est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Marie vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Marie n'a jamais fréquenté. C'est pourquoi depuis son jeune âge, Marie vend des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, assiettes, bols en séries, casseroles, bassines, cuillères, etc.) de façon ambulante. Marie achète ses articles au marché Ounando à Porto-Novo. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
M. Marie was born in 1974 in Djèrègbé, a village located at the entrance of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has been residing in Gbokpa in Djèrègbé for a dozen years. Married to DOSSOU Avocèfohoun, a mason, she is the mother of five children, of whom three are in her care. None of the children are in school. Marie comes to her husband’s aid with regard to family expenses. She never attended school. This is why she has from an early age been selling kitchen utensils (insulated containers, plates, nested bowls, pots, tubs, spoons, etc.) as she goes door-to-door. She purchases her goods at the Ounando market in Porto-Novo. She is a former ALIDé client, having benefited before from two loans, which have been repaid. To increase the size of her business and to satisfy the more and more numerous demands of her customers, she’s requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils (sets of plates and bowls)

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom H. lives Tuol Kandal Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who grows rice on her 2-hectare (5-acre) farm. She does not have enough money to grow the rice, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to hire laborer to work on her rice field. Her husband, Mr. Deip Sina, is a cow middleman. Mrs. Srey Mom H. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children attends the local school; the other child is too young for school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to hire laborer to work on her rice field.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income for Noel, 41, from Norala, South Cotabato. Noel tills a 1.5-hectare rice field and currently needs additional capital to support his farm. He has therefore joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have a chance to obtain a loan. Noel has requested PHP15,000, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: Fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JOSE ANTONIO tiene 74 años, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. El socio es natural de la ciudad D. Cusco. El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. El socio es cesante jubilado D. poder judicial hace 20 años.  

El socio tiene su taller de confección de chompas y también tiene un negocio familiar de venta de artesanía. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como lana para coleccionar chompas y chalinas.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 74 years old; he is married and has five children. He is a native of the city of Cusco. He is a member of the "Ricchary Cusco" Community Bank, in the Arariwa Association. A former employee of the legal system, he has been retired for 20 years. He has a workshop that makes "chompas" (traditional knitted sweaters) and has a family business selling handcrafts. He has been in business for several years and has succeeded through hard work. He is an entrepreneur who provides for his family. He needs this loan to buy materials such as wool to make sweaters and scarves. He is grateful for the opportunity which this loan will provide him, and he undertakes to fulfil the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material such as wool to make sweaters and scarves.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive al lado de su esposo Eriberto y sus 4 hijos: Yaritza de 14, Dorian de 9, Alexis de 6 y Ariana de 4 añitos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar; como cera, desinfectantes, pulidores, entre otros. Ana realiza la venta en un puesto que acondiciona en el mercado más concurrido de su zona; además tiene ventaja por ser la única que vende estos artículos, a ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le resulta cómodo y aunque algunas veces la venta no sea buena, sabe que en todo negocio existen altibajos, por eso se preocupa en ponerle muchas ganas a todo lo que realiza para que en el futuro pueda cosechar los frutos. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete  ser muy puntual con cada uno de los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mejorar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband Eriberto and their four children: Yaritza (age 14), Dorian (age 9), Alexis (age 6) and Ariana (age 4).

Ana sells household cleaning products such as floor wax, disinfectants, polishes, and other items. She offers her products from a vending post in the busiest market in the area. In addition, she has the advantage of being the only retailer who sells these items. Ana enjoys her work because she feels comfortable. Even though her sales are occasionally low, she knows that every business goes through its ups and downs. For this reason, she invests in a great deal of effort into everything she does so that she will have a better future.

This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with each of her loan payments. With the money she requested, Ana will purchase M. merchandise to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Gamage

texts.en: Gamage C. is a 42 year old woman.  She has one son and one daughter. She is lives with her husband. She started her retail business three years ago.  She wants to develop her business but she does not have enough money to purchase sellable items. If she can get sufficient money, she will increase her daily sales and can get more profit.  To make these purchases, she needs 30000 LKR for her business.

loans.use: grocery items such as rice, spices, etc.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en: Catalino is 28 years old and financially independent.  He studied in a technical school where he learned to repair cell phones.  Since 2006, he has run his own shop in which he repairs and sells cell phones and cell phone credit.  Catalino began his business with help from his parents, and later was able to expand his operations through the business' earnings.  He is very well located, only a few meters from the bus station.  Catalino is seeking the loan to purchase cell phones and accessories, which will afford his business a greater variety of products to sell.  This should increase Catalino's earnings.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Mercedes del Carmen A. P., tiene la edad de 22 años y habita en el Barrio La Borgoña este es un barrio donde sus habitantes son personas de escasos recursos.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 11 años y dentro de los principales problemas que se le han presentado ha sido sequía que amenaza con la cosecha, fue gracias a su padre quien le apoyo económicamente para comenzar sus dias en este rubro laboral, hoy en día ella se siente capaz de solicitar un prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas paara diversificar la produccion y abrirse paso a nuevos negocios laborales, tales como la apertura de un tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Carmen A. P. is 22, and she lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. This is a neighborhood where the inhabitants have scant resources. She has devoted herself to farming for 11 years. One of the main problems that she has encountered has been the drought that threatens the crops. She started working in this field thanks to her father, who supported her economically. She now feels capable of asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to diversify the production. She also wants to open the door to new working businesses such as opening a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada T.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. She is 52 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Diosdada has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2004, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Diosdada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her eighth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en: Helen C. is from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Helen is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan. Helen is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business selling fish products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish to local community members. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty E. is a hairdresser and sells hair products as well at Akotokyire. She has received senior high education. She is single and has been in hairdressing for some time now.

Gifty takes care of herself by using her small income to pay for her accommodation, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to sell and also to use for her beauty salon.

Gifty hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell and also to invest in her beauty salon

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka is a 48-year-old married woman and lives with her husband, one daughter, and two sons. 

Renuka's business involves making coir products, and she has a lot of experience with this type of business. She creates carpets, coir mats and so on with the coir, which consists of extracted coconut fibers.  There is strong competition in her area for selling coir products.   Renuka's husband helps her by delivering and selling them to customers, which greatly helps the business.

Renuka has requested a 55,000-rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka, which she will use to buy raw coir and develop the coir products.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy coir for weaving

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Román A., tiene 45 años y vive en el barrio La pradera de Barranquilla, tiene un hijo de 19 años  que estudia en la universidad, con el que sueña que al finalizar su carrera, pueda verlo exitoso con su profesión.
Ana  Román es un cliente que desde el año 2002 participa en las Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y  que sabe en qué momento solicita cada crédito, porque conoce muy bien cuanto se gana y cuanto se debe gastar; cuando inició su relación con esta organización lo hizo para fortalecer su negocio de mercancía como prendas de vestir de distribución en  su vecindad y en su sitio de trabajo en una mueblería, donde hasta la presente está empleada y ahora lo hace para renovar su baño y hacer levante de paredillas en el patio de su casa  para tener mayor seguridad. Con sus anteriores financiamientos logrò mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tiene como meta seguirlo haciendo hasta que su casa esté totalmente adecuada, por eso està solicitando este crédito por valor de  $1.200.000.
Ana vive en un sitio muy comercial ubicado en el suroccidente de la ciudad, muy cercana a comunidades religiosas dedicadas a hacer desarrollo comunitario en comunidades y apoyadas por organizaciones internacionales, lo cual ha ayudado al mejoramiento de su barrio y a hacer que mucha más gente estudie, tenga negocio y mejore sus relaciones familiares, es decir tenga un buen vivir.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and lives in the La Paradera de Barranquilla neighborhood. She has a 19 year old son who attends university and her dream is to see him complete his studies and succeed in his career. Ana has been working with " Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" since 2002. She knows when it's the best time to request loans because she is well aware of how much she earns and how much she should save. She began her relationship in order to increase her inventory of articles of clothing, and be able to deliver within her neighborhood and at a furniture store, where she is currently employed. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to make improvements to her bathroom and repair the walls around her patio to improve the security of her home. She was able to make other improvements with the money from her past loans and her goal is to continue making improvements until her home is adequate. She is asking for a loan of 1,200,000 COP ($625). Ana lives in a commercialized zone, located in the southwest of the city, very near religious communities dedicated to community development and supported by international organizations. They have helped improve her neighborhood and made it possible for many other people to study, start businesses, and improve their family relations; in other words, improving lives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney C. lives in the village of Matugas Bajo, which is located in the part of the Philippines known as Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, married, has two school-aged children and makes a living by providing repair services to people who live in his community.

In 2009, Rodney joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business, and has already successfully repaid two previous loans from GDMPC. He used these loans to expand his small company, and is now applying for a new loan to buy supplies he needs to provide his services. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide his repair services

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Ana is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Ana runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for more than five years. In 2010, Ana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ana from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tobías Emiliano

texts.es:
Tobías Emiliano L. V. tiene 39 años.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Tobías es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Tobías trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, y maíz. También trabaja con motosierra. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas cada semana en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para sembrar papas. También quisiera ampliar el huerto familiar (legumbres para consumir). Piensa que este crédito le dará facilidad para comprar lo que necesita. Su sueño es mejorar su alimentación. Enfrenta desafíos porque no hay lluvia en verano y se necesita agua del rió pero no hay. 

Le gusta trabajar y jugar indoor fútbol.
texts.en:
Tobías Emiliano L. V. is 39 years old. He’s single and has no children. He lives in Guranda canton in Bolívar province. Tobías is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank which is located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is the first loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San José. Tobías farms potatoes, wheat and corn. He also operates a power saw. He makes his purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda. He is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops. He would also like to expand the family garden (vegetables grown for their own consumption). He feels that this loan will facilitate his buying everything he needs. His dream is to improve his nutrition He faces certain challenges because there is no rainfall in summer and water must be gotten from the river but there isn’t any. He enjoys working and playing indoor football.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.name: Vida 1 Group

texts.en:
Agustina is the coordinator of her group, Vida 1 (Life). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to keep her business and make it grow.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying spending time with her family.

Agustina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business, a fried food stand. She has had her business for over three years, after starting it with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in the food stand by buying plantains, potatoes, chicken, beef, flour, and other food items. She will use the profits to invest in her business by moving to another location. Currently her business is in her backyard and she wants to move to the main street of her neighborhood.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because of the opportunity for people who want to invest in business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy goods for her fried food stand

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila B. is from the village of Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan. She is 45 years old. Leonila is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest from it. In 2010, Leonila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Leonila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ma.nieves

texts.en:
Ma. Nieves G. is 51 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: farming and pig fattening. She lives in Purok 4, Brgy. Cabanbanan, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Ma. Nieves is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can fund operations. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Nieves aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

loans.name: Samuel Isidro

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 45 años de edad está casado,  vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de él. Se dedica a la siembra de papayas oficio que aprendió de su padre que también se dedicaba a este tipo de cultivo, actualmente ha sembrado 80 plantas de esta fruta y don Samuel no posee un horario fijo de trabajo. El tipo de fruta que el cultiva es demandada en el mercado por lo que don Samuel cuenta con la certeza de que su producción será vendida.
Él está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes  e insecticidas para darle el tratamiento necesario a la plantación.
Esto ayudara a contar con los materiales necesarios para mantener la plantación en buen estado y que las plagas no afecten su producción, obteniendo una mejor cosecha de papayas y que estás puedan ser comercializadas. 
Él aspira a corto plazo ser un gran productor de papayas, lograr mejores ingresos que le brinden una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 45 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their two children ages 14 and 12, who are economically dependent on him. He is dedicated to the planting of papayas craft that he learned from his father who also did this type of cultivation. He has now planted 80 plants of this fruit and does not have a fixed work schedule. The type of fruit he grows is in demand in the market and Samuel is certain that his production will be sold. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and insecticides to provide the necessary treatment for his plantation. This will help to have the materials needed to maintain the good state of the plantation and make sure that pests do not affect production. This will also help obtain a better harvest of papayas so that they can be commercialized. He aspires to be a great short-term producer of papayas and earn more income to provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to grow papayas

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq P. is a widow and raises four children alone.  He is a successful entrepreneur who has been making bread in Imishli city since 2007. He is an experienced bread baker and bakes the traditional bread at home. Sadiq has been in this business for more than four years. His children help him with his business. Having many customers, Sadiq is able to sell the majority of his products from his home. His monthly turnover is 150 to 200 AZN. However, he also has a shop in the central local market to sell the bread. Now Sadiq is requesting a loan of 800 AZN. He is planning to purchase flour at wholesale, which is the basic requirement of his business. His dream is to open his own store one day.

loans.use: To purchase flour at wholesale

loans.name: Fe Pekit Group

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Fe is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.

Zam has a business of selling spare parts. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Zam sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. Zam has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of spare parts. She also generates additional income through owning a motorcycle for hire.The main business challenge(s) for Zam include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing spare parts from Japan.

Zam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of sapre parts.

loans.name: Grace Nyame Bekyere

texts.en: Grace Nyame Bekyere N. is divorced. She takes care of two children. She has been through junior high school. Grace is a seamstress and sells palm oil at Elmina as well. She has been in this business for 13 years.The loan will help her to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child. Susan has a business of a salon, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Susan hopes to own another salon.

Susan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work together.

loans.use: To buy braids.

loans.name: Habib

texts.ar:
حبيب في عمر 56 سنة يعمل في النجارة فهو له في مصلحته حوالي 40 سنة متزوج وله ولد
يحب عائلته ويريد تأمين حياة كريمة لهم فهو دائم البحث عن التطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى
دفع الاقساط المدرسية لأبنه فهو المعيل الوحيد للعائلة يسعى جاهدا الى دعم ابنه وعائلته تاريخه مع المجموعة جيد
ويلقى دعم كامل من عائلته وزبائنه هم جيرانه ومحبيه
texts.en: Habib is a 56-year-old husband and father who tries hard to secure a dignified life for his family and who in turn is greatly supported by them. Habib has four decades of experience working in carpentry, with his neighbors and loved ones providing patronage. Given his good credit history with Al Majmoua, Habib is now asking for a loan to help pay his son’s school tuition, which is particularly crucial since Habib is the only breadwinner in the family.

loans.use: To pay his son's school tuition

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo B. is from the village of Dulawan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 47 years old. Reynaldo is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he makes and sells langonisa (homemade sausage) in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Reynaldo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Dulawan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Her name is Eufemia and she is 49 years old.  Eufemia is married and has two children. She is requesting the loan to invest in her bakery.  The city of Oropesa, Peru is famous for making bread and she is planning on using the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make bread.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her bakery

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan lives in the city of Jaranwala, located in Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its agricultural industry.  She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter, and all of them are young and getting their education.  The family has lived in Jaranwala for 20 years. 

Her husband works in a private organization and she supports him by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. Maqsoodan is skilled in her work and receives regular orders from her community members. She has been in this profession for four years and she has never received any complaints from her customers.  

Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine.  The old machine doesn’t produce a completed dress in a timely manner, and the new machine will help her work more efficiently and make better profits.  She is a regular borrower of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With the previous loan she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Maqsoodan”.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Flor M. es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

Doña Flor tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es profesional en mecánica y tiene un taller propio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Flor labora en el taller de su esposo de lunes a viernes, también tiene su propio negocio, ella vende productos de hierbalife y ropa por catálogo, esta actividad  la realiza desde hace 6 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos hierbalife y también en repuestos para vehículos. Su meta es crecer mas en su negocio en especial en la venta de productos de herbalife.
texts.en:
Flor M. is a member of the “More than Victorious” cooperative bank.  She lives in the city of Azogues, known for its beauty and its mix of modern and colonial elements.  The residents are very friendly and cordial.

Flor is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children ages 18, 16, 9 and 7.  Her first child, a son, is a student.  Her second, a daughter, is married and living independently.  Her two youngest children study at a local school.  Her husband is a mechanic and has his own workshop.  They do not own their home but, instead, are renting.

Flor works in her husband’s workshop Mondays through Fridays.  She also has her own business selling Hierbalife products as well as clothing by catalog, an activity she has carried out for 6 years.

She has been a member of the cooperative bank for 6 years, and plans to invest the funds from her loan into buying Hierbalife products as well as car replacement parts.  Her goal is to see her business grow, especially her Hierbalife products sales.

loans.use: To purchase Hierbalife products as well as car replacement parts.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tienen 3 hijos que están en edad escolar.  Ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con el que compró cinco casacas por el valor de s/.60.00 nuevo soles.
Actualmente tiene dos tipos de actividades principales: producción de truchas y venta de casacas, los productos de este último los compra en desaguadero y los vende en Ilave.
En el negocio de la producción de truchas recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, además su esposo es albañil y trabaja en las construcciones de la zona.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos docenas de casacas y el resto lo utilizará para comprar alimento para truchas. 
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio  y dar educación a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la alegría y las bromas entre las socias.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank named "Maria Asuncion Galindo", located in the district of Juli in the Chucuito-Juli province in the department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and she has 3 school-aged children. She was able to graduate high school. 

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past twelve years.  The first loan was in the amount of S/300 nuevos soles and she used it to purchase give jackets, valued at S/60 nuevos soles each. She currently has two businesses: trout hatchery and jacket sales. The products of the last business type are purchases in Desaguadero and later resold in Ilave. 

For the trout hatchery business she gets help from her husband and children. Her husband is also a construction worker and he works in construction projects in the region. 

With this loan, amounting to S/1200 nuevos soles, she will purchase two dozen jackets and the remaining funds will be used to purchase feed for her trout.

Her dream is to improve her business and to provide her children with an education. What she most likes about her communal bank is the good humor and jokes played among the members.

loans.use: To purchase 2 dozen jackets and to purchase feed for trout.

loans.name: Consolatres

texts.en: Consolatres is a married woman who lives in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and food production - making Chorizo sausages. Her husband Samuel,  works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 17 years old. Consolatres joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Consolatres has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase feed for the pigs and also purchase ingredients for her Chorizo production so that she can continue to save up for her child’s education and support household needs. Consolatres is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase feed and ingredients for Chorizo production

loans.name: Elvia Betsabeth

texts.es: Elvia, tiene 30 años es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, ella actualmente se dedica a brindar el servicio de alquiler de autos para taxi , sus principales clientes son vecinos de su zona, ella los atiende con gran  amabilidad y calidez, esta actividad la desempeña por  mas de 3 años, negocio que le ha permitido obtener mayores ingresos que le sirven para los gastos de la casa, ya que tiene que afrontar sola la manutención de su menor hijo, quien aún esta en edad escolar, adicional a este negocio también se dedica a la venta de ropa en su domicilio, negocio que le permite generar ingresos, el sueño de Elvia es poder hacer crecer su negocio e implementarlo con venta de otros accesorios que le permiten trabajar desde la comodidad de su domicilio, ella desea invertir en la compra de ropa la cual podra ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elvia, age 30, is a single mother who lives in the home of her parents.  She currently has a service renting out automobiles to use as taxis.  Her main customers are neighbors from the area.  She attends to them with great kindness and warmth.  Elvia has been in the taxi rental business for more than three years and it has enabled her to earn more income to cover her household expenses.  

She has sole responsibility of taking care of her young son who is in school.   In addition, Elvia has another business in which she sells clothing from her home.  This business allows her to generate extra income. Her dream is to grow her business and equip it with other accessories that will permit her to work from the comfort of her home. She would like to invest in the purchase of clothes to offer to her clients and in this way earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and to maintain her vehicles

loans.name: Girmanie

texts.en:
Girmanie P. is thirty-three years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has five children: two girls and three boys. Although she is a high school dropout who only completed grade five, she runs her own snacks business in her community. She sells potato chips and plantain chips amongst others.

Girmanie has requested a loan to purchase more flour and oil, so that she can produce more chips on a daily basis. She hopes her local business can one day be an international one and she hopes to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and oil

loans.name: Honoré Adohoungbo

texts.fr: Né le 03 Juin 1971 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, Honoré habite le quartier Abogomè à Akpro-Missérété dans le département de l'Ouémé, depuis un an environ. Honoré est marié à Marguerite et a six enfants à charge, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Honoré n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris le métier de chauffeur. Parallèlement à cette activité, Honoré vend des pièces détachées à Porto-Novo ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. Honoré achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. En vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Honoré sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Dans l'avenir, Honoré désire étendre beaucoup plus son activité.
texts.en: Born on 3 June 1971 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Honoré has lived in the Abogomé area of Akpro-Missérété in the Ouémé department for about one year. He is married to Marguerite and has six children in his care, of whom four are his own. Some of the children are in school. The couple take care of the various household expenses together. Honoré did not attend school, but trained to be a driver. Along with this activity, he sells spare parts in Porto-Novo, which allows him to take care of himself and his family. He buys his goods in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. With the goal of raising the level of his business and better satisfying the demands of his clientele, Honoré is seeking his first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). In the future, Honoré hopes to significantly extend his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Y. is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. He is 45 years old. Joseph is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines & mackerel in the local community. He also provides deliveries of fish to nearby neighborhoods. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like milkfish & mackerel. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish such as milkfish & mackerel.

loans.name: Ramon Abel

texts.es:
Ramón, vive con sus hijos de 19, 17 y 12 años de edad  y su esposa,  él se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y elabora hamacas, el negocio de lubricantes tiene dos años de existir, pero elaborando hamacas lleva 15 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para preparar las hamacas como hilo de seda de varios colores también comprara lubricantes, con esta inversión podrá tener material para la elaboración de las hamacas y ofrecer a los clientes lubricantes.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos puedan graduarse de la Universidad y se superen en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ramón lives with his wife and his children, aged 19, 17 and 12. He sells lubricants and makes hammocks. The lubricants business is two years old, but he has been making hammocks for 15 years.

At this time, he is asking for a loan to buy materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread in a variety of colors. He will also buy lubricants. With this loan, he will be able to have material to make the hammocks and offer his customers lubricants.

His goal is for his children to be able to graduate from the university and get ahead in the future.

loans.use: to buy silk thread in a variety of colors. He will also buy lubricants.

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: Elia tiene 38 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años se dedica a agricultura y ganadería, sin embargo no le era suficiente, por ello optó hace 10 años tener un negocio adicional, que es la venta de leña, actividad que lo realiza dentro de los espacios de su casa. Para ello cuenta con una sierra eléctrica, para que pueda cortar los troncos de madera que compra y que luego son vendidos a sus vecinos o clientes que le solicitan. Es así como se gana la vida, permitiéndole tener los ingresos cada semana y con ello puede cubrir las necesidades de su familia; además puede invertir en las anteriores actividades, como la agricultura y ganadería, pero por el momento desea incrementar de más leña para vender, por ello pide de su ayuda para que pueda continuar con su trabajo.
