Este será  su crédito número 3 con MFP, eso la motivará a esforzarse más en sus ventas y tener seguridad el tener un respaldo financiero, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito solicitado, invertirá en la compra de más troncos de madera.
texts.en:
Elia, 38 years old, lives with her three children in her own house.  For over 20 years she has been farming and working with livestock.  However, this was not enough for her.  Ten years ago she opted to have an additional business selling firewood.  She does this in the space behind her her house.  

To do this she has an electric saw so that she is able to cut the wood logs that she buys.  She then sells them to her neighbors or to customers who request them.  That is how she earns a living, which allows her to have income every week.  With this income she is able to cover the family necessities.  She is also able to invest in her business activities mentioned above like farming and livestock.

Now she wishes to have more firewood to sell.  That is why she is asking for your help to be able to continue working.  This will be her third loan with MFP.  This will encourage her to work more in her sales, and it will give her the security of financial support.  She pledges to make her payments on time.  She will use the requested loan to buy more wood logs.

loans.use: to buy wood logs.

loans.name: Sorom

texts.en:
Sorom, age 36, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is employed at a hotel in the city, earning an income of $3 per day. 

Sorom is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a tuk-tuk for her husband to start a new motorcycle transport business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk for her husband to start a new business.

loans.name: Olpha

texts.en:
Olpha is 26 years old and a hardworking lady. She is married and blessed with two children aged four and five. She has been running a retail shop since 2005.

Olpha joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could access business loans easily. So far, she has been able to expand her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. She has requested 20, 000 KES to buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: 03.2.85.quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hiền is 22 years old and she is married with one child. Hiền is the group leader of the 03.2.85.Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Hiền supports one dependent with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to travel for vacation within the country, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo, 51, is married to a vendor named Aida and they have five school-aged children. To sustain his family's needs, Danilo works hard and does his best to maintain his farming business. He grows rice and has been doing this for almost 30 years. The income generated from the business goes towards his family's basic needs and school fees.

Danilo is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his crop production.

In the future, Danilo hopes to improve his farming business in order to continuously send all his children to school to get degrees in order to assure better futures for them.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for his crop production.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda, 51, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a cook, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Linda operates a coin bank manufacturing business. She buys raw materials used in coin bank production and processes it to produce colorful coin banks. Her finished products were distributed to markets, general stores and other places where she has contacts for her products where she earns a margin for every coin bank she delivers. She earns a minimum of Php7500 in profit every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in coin bank production and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Linda dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to tap more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to produce colorful coin banks

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 40 years old and married with 2 children, ages 4 and 22.  She runs a Pharmacy store in Aberdeen-western part in Freetown.  She has 1 employee working with her.  

Marie has been in this business for 5 years and sells malaria drugs, blood tonic and cosmetics at her store.  She also earns income from renting out a house.  She says that the main challenge to her business is problems with transportation to travel with drugs from a neighboring country.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more malaria drugs, blood tonic and cosmetics.  Marie says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status and increase her business level.  In the future, she would like to expand her business to a clinic level.

loans.use: To purchase more malaria drugs, blood  tonic and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
Rolando, tiene treinta y cinco años de edad, es casado y con dos  hijos que dependen actualmente de el y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
Rolando acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su vivienda, por lo  que este préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
Todo esto es para que su familia goce de mejores condiciones de una vivienda.
texts.en:
Rolando, age 35, is married with two school-aged children who depend on him. 
Rolando has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for home improvements. He will use this loan to purchase construction materials to repair the roof of his home, since it is in bad shape.
All of this is so that his family can enjoy better living conditions in their home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Mairamkul is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brought up a daughter and a son. The daughter is a nurse and the son works in construction. Mairamkul is a nurse in the local hospital. In 2005 she saved 15,000 soms and started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns additional money to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase cattle for fattening and further reselling. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she plans to start repairing the house. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a focused business man.  He is 23 years old and single.  For the last three years, he has been operating a bicycle transport business to make a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has become more business-oriented. He hopes to buy a van for his transport business in five years. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a second-hand motorbike for his transport business.

loans.use: buy a second-hand motorbike

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a home-based general store located in the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. She has been in this business for four years, and she also earns additional income from her hog-raising business. She is raising four for fattening and one sow. The couple works hard to provide the financial needs of her children. Gloria's husband is welder, farmer and tricycle driver.

Gloria has requested a loan amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more items such as biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and soft drinks for her store. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her store and raise all the piglets of her sow. In this way, she could improve her hog-raising business, increase her sales and support her five children until they could finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей родом из Ивано-Франковска, Западная Украина. Он предоставляет услуги пассажирских перевозок и параллельно торгует подержанными автомобилями. Авто – это любимое дело Сергея и его главная страсть. В автобизнесе Сергей уже не первый год. За последние 10 лет он смог раскрутиться и сейчас его ежемесячный доход составляет 6 000 гривен. 

Сергею необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы осуществить текущий ремонт своего автомобиля и подготовить его к зиме, поменяв колеса, аккумулятор и т.п. Со временем Сергей надеется поменять авто на другое, приобретя более новое транспортное средство. Со временем Сергей надеется скопить достаточно денег и приобрести собственное жилье. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Sergei was born in Ivano-Frankivsk in the Western Ukraine. He provides passenger transportation services and also sells used cars. Auto is Sergei's favorite business and his ruling passion. It's not the first year that Sergei is in the auto business. During the past ten years he was able to develop it and now his monthly income is 6,000 hryvna.

Sergei needs a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvna to realize the repairs for his vehicle and prepare it for the winter, change the tires, battery, etc. With time Sergei hopes to change the car to another one and buy a newer transportation vehicle. He hopes to save money in time to buy his own place to live.

loans.use: to realize the repairs on his vehicle and prepare it for the winter by changing the tires, battery, etc.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is 27 years old and widowed with seven children.  She owns rental houses which earn her a living.  She has been renting out the houses for nine years. Being the breadwinner in her family, she works hard in her business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve the houses, hence attracting more customers.  She hopes to own a hotel in five years.  She needs a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the houses.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is married with 5 children. Raul is 38-years-old and lives in New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Raul sells toyo to earn a living and  had this business for 4 years. Each month, he earns PHP 15000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 20000 to purchase 20 gallons of soy sauce to sell/retail.

Raul has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Raul hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 gallons of  soy sauce to sell/retail.

location.town: Liloy-New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ebou Nebila Benedicte

texts.fr:
Mme EBOU NEBILA BENEDICTE  est mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. Tous  vont  à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle fait la couture depuis 2ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché de pissy. Ses clients sont  les femmes, hommes et enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  une autre machine, un rouleau de popiline, un paquet de fils, un paquet de tire-éclair et ½ rouleau de collants.

 Avec  ses bénéfices, elle  renforcer  son activité et s’occupe de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un magasin de pagnes ajouter, agrandir son atelier.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ebou Nebila Benedicte is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 12. All are in school. She has five dependents.

She has been working as a seamstress for two years. She stocks up at the Pissy market. Her customers are men, women and children. She would like to buy a new sewing machine, a roll of poplin, a pack of threads, a pack of zippers and half a roll of elastic. Thanks to her income, she [will] strengthen her business and take care of her family. Her goal is to open a store selling traditional “pagnes” fabrics and to expand her sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a roll of poplin, a pack of threads, a pack of zippers and half a roll of elastic

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Mrs Hou earns a living by farming together with her husband from Prey Chor district, Cambodia.  She is now thirty-five years old and is blessed with two young children.  Growing rice crops is a big part of her life.  

Mrs Hou grows rice crops twice a year because she gets enough water from the river nearby to sustain this.  She typically earns a profit of $2.5 per day from this business.  In order to increase her profits for the whole family, she has requested a loan from Kiva, through HKL to purchase some piglets to raise and sell in the future.  Mrs Hou wants to improve her living conditions as she works hard and provide her two daughters with great opportunities to join university in Phnom Penh city.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets to raise and sell on.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary extracts palm oil for sale at Efutu. She has been doing this for the past 18 years now. 

Mary is married to a farmer and has four children. Mary assists the husband to pay utility bills.  

She needs this loan to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale. With the new profit, Mary plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract oil for sale.

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  He has been practicing poultry farming for over four years in his hometown of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He sells eggs to the local market. He also works as a support staff in the local school to earn extra income.

Tonui is requesting a second loan for 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy additional poultry birds. The additional income will help him boost his family's standard of living. His first loan of 20,000 KES allowed him to acquire a lot of experience.  He laments the high cost of feeds for poultry birds.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Hickel

texts.en:
Hickel is 31 years old and lives in Tuyabang Proper, Oroquieta City. He is married and has one child. Hickel has a hog raising business, earning approximately PHP 5,000 each month from it. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pig feed and vitamins for his business.

Hickel has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to earn money because he wants to send his child to school until he graduates from college. Hickel is a hardworking father and an honest person.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba specializes in selling gari, a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starchy powdered cassava. She has been involved in this business for a long time. 

Araba is a junior high school graduate. She is married to a security officer, and they have three children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping to support herself and her extended family. 

Araba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory by buying more gari for sale. 

She plans to reinvest future profits into her business to help her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands, to help her children receive the best education, and to pay her utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more gari for sale.

loans.name: Yelognisse 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YELOGNISSE 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Dédé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dédé est mariée a un infirmier du nom de Emile. Dédé a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Dédé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Dédé vend depuis douze ans du riz, de la pâte de maïs accompagnée de diverses sauces. Dédé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour  accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Dédé ensemble avec les membres du groupe YELOGNISSE 1 sollicite un cinquième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du poisson, du riz et du maïs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Korloe Gonore with her family. She is married with a child. She runs a yam store (retail) business where she sells yams. She has been doing this for 15 years.

Amina has become proficient in this business, and she eagerly wants to enhance this livelihood. Her problem is she lacks capital to run this business continuously, because her capital is used for other emergency needs such as daily consumption and bills.

With this loan, she needs an amount to buy more stock of yams needed in her store. Amina wants to enhance her store business in the future to be able to start other business opportunities that augment her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock of yams needed in her store.

loans.name: Chanthim's Group

texts.en: Chanthim, a farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is 29 years and a mother of one child. To support on her family’s living, she is growing cassava as her single main source of income for 11 years. Her cassava did not grow well because of it has destroyed by insects. For Chanthim, this is her first loan with VisionFund and she leads a group of two members to apply this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to input her cassava farmland in order to produce more yields. She hopes that she can earn more income and get higher yield than last year, so she can upgrade her living standard as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to input her cassava farmland in order to produce more yields.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Instrument tuning, uniform

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en: Mrs Apaula K. is a 53 year old lady, currently running a pancake business from her house. She’s a widow with 5 children, all four employed locally, and one living in Australia. With Apaula’s business, she started off from selling it at the market, where as she’s now moved back to her house and selling it there, due to more demand from a primary school near by that at the market place. She is now also baking mini pies in assorted flavors as well as toasted breads with fried eggs. As from experience she believes that starting from frying pancakes only, one day she’ll develop into a bakery shop, and it’s her dream to be fulfilled.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her bakeries

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan Zbirnea and his wife, Vera are a young family.  Together they have four children and live in the regional center of Orhei.  Ruslan has been worried for some time about not being able to provide for his family and realized the only way to make a sustainable future for his family was to start his own business.  Ruslan comes from an agricultural background yet he has no land to start a farm.  After studying different possibilities he has decided to start growing mushrooms.  Growing mushrooms requires very little land and the initial investment is reasonable which makes it an ideal micro business startup for any entrepreneur. Ruslan decided to start growing mushrooms in his cellar of his house where all the conditions necessary to grow mushrooms (ventilation of air, humidity control and temperature) are easily maintained.  Ruslan will sell his mushrooms at the local market or to wholesalers in bulk quantities where there is a market for roughly 10-15 Kilograms per day of mushrooms.  To develop his business, Ruslan needs a loan to procure high quality spores, specific bags for growing mushrooms and to make repairs to a ventilation system.

loans.use: To purchase spores for mushrooms, specific sacks and make repairs on a ventilation system.

loans.name: Moira

texts.es:
Moira lives in a rented home with her two children; she has been separated from her husband for 6 years. Two months ago, she used her savings to begin a small business. She sells metal working materials, buying her stock and then selling it to the metal workers, where she has been warmly received. Her first loan with Impro was for education, which she repayed punctually. Now she has come back to Impro to apply for a new loan which she will use to purchase more metal working materials and to stabilize her new business. Her previous history with Impro demonstrates she is a good candidate to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Moira vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos; ella esta separada del esposo hace más de seis años. Con sus ahorros hace dos meses inicio la actividad de venta de material de ferretería comprando lo necesario y fue a ofrecer a las ferreterías, donde tuvo muy buena aceptación. El primer crédito que solicito a IMPRO fue para educación, el cual lo pago puntualmente. Ahora recurre a Impro para solicitar un nuevo crédito que será destinado a capital de arranque que servirá para comprar mas material de ferretería e iniciar la actividad ya como un negocio estable. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase matieral

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana N. Y. Abrego Quisgue, 21, started selling food at the local school six months ago with her first loan from Friendship Bridge. She sells tostadas, ice cream, chips, juices, hot dogs and drinks. She also makes and sells tortillas, the major staple in the everyday diet of the people of Guatemala. Guatemalans don't prefer the machine-made type but rather the ones that are made by hand by patting freshly milled corn dough and cooking them to perfection on a hot metal plate. She makes about 65 tortillas a day and sells them for about US$0.12 for 6 hand-made tortillas. Making the tortillas has been challenging for her lately because several months ago she fell at a circus and badly broke her arm and lost almost all movement of her hand. The break is evident from the 6 inch scar on her upper arm. Making tortillas can sometimes be very painful. But on the worst days she is happy to be working with a partner who helps her get through the day.

Ana is single and lives with her mom and her 5 other brothers and sisters. Her dreams are still developing and as of now she wants to make money to save for her.future.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase food to make and sell at her stand

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
My name is Otilia and I sell bakery products (donuts and bread). I own a micro company in my house and I distribute the merchandise to the grocery stores in the city of El Paraíso. I count on many years of experience in this activity and it provides me the money I need to contribute with the expenses of my family and also to make some improvements to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Otilia, m i actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de hornado ( roquillas y pan), cuento con una micro empresa en mi casa de habitación, mi producto lo distribuyo de manera ambulante en las diferentes pulperias de la ciudad de El Paraíso, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, logrando asi realizar algunas mejoras en mi casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, flour, cheese, candy, butter and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk from farmers.

loans.name: Rosa De La Cruz

texts.es:
Rosa's daily work starts at her home, when she leaves each morning to transport the 2 carts containing hot dogs to her sales location. She has 9 years of experience in this business; she started with $700 in capital loaned to her by a microfinance organization.

With that first loan, she began selling hot dogs, sweets and soft drinks on the corner close to the Cathedral of León. Daily she fought the fatigue caused by the sun, hoping in the future to have her own sales stall in the market.

Later Mrs. Díaz S. was visited by Ceprodel's loan staff and received the financial help she needed to develop her business. That was 2 years ago; she has received 35 loans since then. The loan has had a positive impact on her business, including its expansion and growth.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Su actividad económica da inicio desde su casa en donde acarrea dos carretones conteniendo hot dogs hasta su puesto de venta. Teniendo 9 años de experiencia en este negocio, la señora Rosa inició con un capital de C$700.00 producto de un préstamo que hizo en una micro financiera.

Comenzó a vender los hot dog, golosinas y refrescos ubicado el negocio en la esquina cerca de la iglesia de la Catedral de León, teniendo que luchar a diario contra la fatiga del sol, esperando en el futuro llegar a tener un local propio en el mercado.

Posteriormente la señora Díaz S. fue visitada por personal de crédito de Ceprodel y recibió la ayuda financiera necesaria para desarrollarse hace 2 años, habiendo recibido 35 créditos que han tenido impacto positivo en su negocio como lo es la ampliación de este mismo.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is married with 4 children. Before the loan, Mr. K. was an apprentice in a welding shop for 8 years. With the help of his family, and the previous loans, Musa established his own workshop in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. He recently invested the income to buy a new generator.

Musa is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase materials for making steel doors, windows, and other items.

loans.use: Musa is putting all his years of apprenticeship into practice and needs a loan to help develop his own welding business.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Mrs. Chheang S., 36, a widow with four children, sells oranges and mangoes in the market, normally earning $4 a day. Two of her daughters help her to sell the products and two others are students. She requests a loan of $500 from Kiva to purchase a motor bike to transport her produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike.

loans.name: Zas

texts.en: Mrs. Zas M., from the Mean Chey District, located about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City, buys fresh fish to dry and sell to customers from her home. She earns $3 per day and has six children, one of whom is married. Her husband, 53-year-old Mr. El Him, helps dry fish with his wife and is a part-time fisherman. With their increasing customer base, Mrs M. needs capital to expand the business.  She therefore requests a loan of $600 to buy more fresh fish to dry and sell.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Johana Gutierrez

texts.es:
Johana works as a domestic servant. She has a 2 year-old boy and lives with a partner who works as a building worker and supports her economically. Johana’s dream is to strengthen her family and improve their life conditions. One of her goals is to improve her house and the loan requested is to build a wall and this way erect her house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Johana trabaja como doméstica en una casa de habitación. Tiene un niño de 2 años y es acompañada, su compañero se desempeña como albañil y le apoya económicamente. El sueño de Johana es llegar a consolidar su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dentro de las mejoras está la de su casa, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para levantar una pared en su casa de habitación y así ir levantándola poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase material to build a wall to improve living conditions at home.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N., 66 years old, earns about $2.25 per day by selling beverages from her home in the Kasekam Village, Siem Reap Province. N. lives with her husband Chhit Nhem, 66 years old, and her seven children, four single and three married. Nhem is a fisherman earning around $2.25 per day and his children Kim and Sambath are bricklayers earning around $3 per day. With a stable business and the desire to upgrade in the future, N. now requests a loan of $300 to help her husband business. This will ensure Nhem and N.’s financial stability as well as help their children to go to school.

loans.use: To help her husband's business

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreang C. is a subsistence farmer in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside of this business activity, she is a firewood seller. Her husband, Mr. Vann Huth, is a palm juice collector. She is a 24 year old mother three: one of whom is attending a local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs. Sreang C.’s business is facing difficulties because she cannot transport  fertilizers to fill the rice field; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a cart.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to transport  fertilizers

loans.name: Silvana Jose

texts.es:
Mrs. J. is associated with the Leon 2000 Foundation, having gone through 4 credit cycles, all of which have been working capital. Her business is the sale of Italian gold articles, gold plated items, and silver articles. She also carries out shoe sales alongside a sister of hers that has a stand and yields a portion for her business.

This person lives at home with her in-laws and she does not have children. Her greatest dream is to have children and to have her own house. She is attending a course on decorating but she has not developed the idea, especially becuase this country is not big on this type of service.

Her husband works outside the home and he provides support for her projects, as a small business owner. Her sales she carries out in cash and on credit and she collects payments on pay days, depending on the amount of credit, she recovers the sum within two months. Her major clientele are university students in the National University of Nicaragua, and the people in the market. She buys items in wholesale paying cash, this way she can generate a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora J., tiene de trabajar con fundación leon 2000, cuatro ciclos de prestamos, todos han sido para capital de trabajo teniendo como actividad la venta de prendas de oro Italiano, oro laminado, prendas de plata , dedicandose tambien al comercio de calzado, en conjunto con una hermana ya que ésta tiene un tramo y le cede un pequeño espacio para que doña silvana oferte tambien parte de su mercaderia. La señora vive en casa de sus suegros, no tiene hijos, su mayor sueño es tener hijos y tener su casa propia, ella tiene un curso en decoraciones pero que no lo ha desarrollado ya que en nuestro país no es bien demandado este servicio. Su esposo trabaja fuera del departamento, quien a su vez le ayuda y le apoya en sus proyectos, como microempresaria. En cuanto a sus ventas estas las realiza de contado y credito que recupera en dias de pago, dependiendo del monto en credito lo recupera en un plazo no mayor a los dos meses, sus principales clientes son docentes de la universidad nacional autonoma de nicaragua, y personas de los mercados. Ella compra por lotes de prendas, de contado totalmente ya que de esta manera le genera mas ganancias.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Madame Minata Dembélé agée 46 ans et mère de 5 enfants (1 garçon et 4 filles), vit dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala (préfecture de Koutiala région de Sikasso République du Mali) avec son mari et ses enfants  Elle n’a pas été scolarisée pour des raisons sociales. Afin d’avoir une activité lucrative elle s’inscrit au centre de formation des soeurs réligieuses italiennes auprès desquelles elle a appris le tricotage (la confection d’habits). Depuis maintenant 15 ans elle exerce cette activité à son domicile.

Madame  Minata Dembélé est en rélation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans. Elle a obtenu 8 prêts solidaires (prets de groupe) avec une association de son quartier et est à son premier prêt  individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Elle s’approvisionne généralement au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue ses ventes à crédit et au comptant à domicile (nuit et jour),dans la ville de Koutiala de facon ambulante et souvent dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt  5 cartons de laine (qui sront tricotés et transformés en habits). Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 100 000FCFA.
Dans l’avenir elle veut avoir: un métier  de tissage de laine pour pouvoir former des jeunes filles deseouvrées..
texts.en:
Ms. Minata Dembélé, age 36, is the mother of five children (one boy and four girls). She lives with her husband and children in a monogamous family in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (Koutiala Prefecture, in the Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). For social reason, she did not receive an education. In order to have gainful work, she signed up at a training center belonging to Italian nuns with whom she learned how to knit clothing. She has been doing this work in her home for fifteen years now.

Ms. Minata Dembélé has been associated with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for four years. She obtained eight solidarity loans (group loans) with an association in her district and is on her first individual loan. Each of her preceding loans was correctly repaid.

She generally gets her supplies at the grand marketplace of Koutiala and makes sales out of her home (cash or credit accepted) day and night, in the city of Koutiala door-to-door, and often at weekly fairs in surrounding towns, to customers who are essentially women. She intends to realize a profit of 100,000 francs CFA. In the future, she wants a career in weaving in order to be able to train unemployed girls.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of wool yarn for knitting

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Dame F. PAULINE est née le 25 Janvier 1981 à POBE au BENIN. Mariée et sans enfant, elle vivait auprès de sa maman dame EMILOLA Ekpèbi et l'avait aidé pendant de nombreuses années dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine. Ayant pris goût à ce commerce, elle a continué sur la même lignée quand elle a rejoint son époux. Elle vend ses articles à crédit à ses clients et se charge dans un second temps de la collecte de ce qui est dû par ses clients en passant chez chacun d'eux. Dame F. Pauline distribue également des tissus. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour satisfaire ses clients combien nombreux et assez exigeants.
texts.en:
Pauline F., who was born on January 25, 1981 in Pobe, Benin, is married but has no children. She used to live with her mother Ekpebi Emilola, and for many years assisted her in selling kitchen utensils. Having acquired a taste for this trade, she has continued in this business since her marriage. She sells items to her customers on credit, taking it upon herself later to go door-to-door to collect what is owed to her. Mrs. F. also deals in cloth. She is seeking this loan to satisfy her customers, no matter the number, or however challenging their requirements might be.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 13 lengths of fabric of various quality, a dozen drinking glasses, a dozen ice chests, and 15 dozen saucepans

loans.name: Liceth

texts.es:
La señora Liceth, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a  la  venta de madera, ropa para bebes y ropa para dormir para damas y ropa interior. Desarrolla el negocio en su casa y también recorriendo algunos lugares cercanos. Sus clientes son las personas de los caseríos y personas que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará telas, elásticos, blondas, hilos, ropa para bebes y madera para así poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razón de su negocio.

Liceth tiene  50 años de edad, es natural de Tingo María, vive con su esposo y tiene 01 hija quien es el motor para seguir trabajando. Se caracteriza por ser muy optimista y luchadora para conseguir sus metas, más adelante piensa poner su negocio en un local fijo bien ubicado e implementarlo, así como también construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liceth is a member of "Las Brisas de la Molina II." She lives in the county and province of San Martin, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She sells lumber, baby clothes and women's pajamas and underwear. She has developed her business from her own home and also travels through nearby areas. Her customers are those who work on the farm and who live in the same town. With this loan that will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy fabrics, elastic, silk lace, thread, baby clothes and lumber so that she can provide her customers with the items they have requested. Liceth is 50 years old and is originally from Tingo Maria, she lives with her husband and has one daughter, who is her greatest motivation to continue to work as hard as she does. She is characterized by her optimism and works hard to meet her goals in life. In the future, she would like to relocated her business to a storefront in a market. She would also like to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, elastic, silk threads and cotton threads, etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Ajšuna

texts.en:
Ajšuna was born in 1973. She lives in Grapska, an agricultural village in Bosnia. Grapska was completely destroyed during the Bosnian war in the 1990s, but Ajšuna returned to the village in 2000. She is married with 2 children, who are 6 years and 18 months old. Her husband has a steady job, but earns only 400KM/month, the equivalent of roughly $262 USD/month.  

To help support her family, Ajšuna grows vegetables and raises cows and chickens.  

She is requesting a loan of 600KM ($400 USD) from Women for Women International which she will use to purchase a calf.  She hopes to sell milk and milk products in the local market, and use the additional income to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
El Sr. José tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez 380, en la capital de Managua, casado con  tres hijos de 9, 13, y 15 años de edad, que actualmente los tiene estudiando en un colegio del barrio. Sus planes son construir su casa y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos y esposa.
Tiene un pequeño taller de enderezados y pintura con Veinte años de experiencia, el negocio se inicio con  ingreso propio. Sus planes de incrementar su ingreso con nuevas inversiones en herramientas de trabajo para el taller y arreglará el techo del taller. 
Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes será hecho realidad, y le podrá ofrecer a sus cliente calidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 41 years old and lives in the Enrique Bermudez 380 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He is married with three children who are 9, 13, and 15 years old and are all currently students in the neighborhood school. He would like to build a more comfortable home for his children and wife. He has run a small paint and repair workshop for the past 20 years which he started with his own capital. He would like to increase his income by investing in new tools for the shop and by fixing the shop's roof. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, he will be able to make his dreams a reality and offer greater quality and safety for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new tools for his shop in order to offer more services

loans.name: Juana Miriam

texts.es:
L. señora Juana Miriam G. D. D. L. C., tiene 55 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en L. calle L. Marina 634 del Puerto Marítimo  D. Salaverry provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta quinto año D. primaria, no continuó estudiando debido a L. falta D. recursos económicos. Se casó D. 14 años,  tuvo 10 hijos, dos D. ellos murieron, ahora dependen D. elL. 3 jóvenes estudiantes.
VenD. cerveza y golosinas en su casa, siempre realizó ese trabajo.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró armarios para exponer sus golosinas.
Con este crédito D. 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en cerveza.
Juana sueña con tener una tienda granD..
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Miriam G. D. L. C. is 55 years old and belongs to the Enterprising Women II Communal Bank. She lives at 634 Marina Street in the seaport of Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo, department of L. Libertad, Peru. She studied until fifth graD. but then did not continue studying because she didn’t have the money. She married at 14 years old and had 10 children, two of whom died, and now three of her children are dependent on her and are students. She sells beer and sweets from her home, which she has always done. With the first loan of 300 soles ($100), which she repaid in 4 months, she bought cabinets to display her sweets. With this loan of 800 soles ($275), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy beer. Juana dreams of having a big store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer to sell in her store

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina O., a 28-year-old resident of Abofour, a city in the Ashanti region of Ghana, is the married mother of two children, both elementary school students. A vendor of both fresh and cooked eggs, she balances her stock on her head as she sells in the neighborhood. Since egg prices have almost doubled over the last few months due to the discovery of bird flu on some poultry farms, she is requesting a loan to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes.

Ernestina recently added plastic bowls to her inventory so that when demand for one product declines, she can at least rely on the other for income. She sells the eggs in the morning at the market center and in the afternoon hawks the plastic bowls throughout the community.

Ernestina hopes to earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy a supply of fresh eggs and plastic bowls for her business.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en:
Chinyere O. sells note books and stationary supplies. She sells her goods from street to street within her community. She now hopes to expand her business. 

She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more note books and stationary materials to sell. 

Chinyere is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more note books and stationary material to sell

loans.name: Thelma Janeth

texts.es:
La venta ambulante require de mucho esfuerzo por el desgaste físico y la exposición al sol que afecta fuertemente. En el municipio de El Sauce, la señora Thelma N. se dedica a su actividad de venta ambulante de calzados con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Los calzados son vendidos de diferentes medidas y para todos los gustos. La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual comprar la mercadería como lo son los calzados para seguir comercializándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Traveling vendors require much effort, strongly affected by physical exertion and exposure to the sun. In the municipality of El Sauce, Mrs. Thelma N. sells footwear to sustain her family. She sells shoes of all sizes to suit all tastes. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to get credit so she can buy merchandise to keep selling in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is fifty-five years old. She is married with five children, two males and three females. One of her children is pursuing a tertiary programme and another in senior high school. The rest are in junior high and the basic schools.

Adwoa is a businesswoman. She sells all kinds of goods. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Adwoa sells items such as yams, maize, clothes, cosmetics, etc. She buys her goods from the nearby towns and villages and sells in the local market square. Adwoa also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years. She wants a loan to procure more goods to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to send her children to school up to high levels.

loans.use: To procure goods for re-sale

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 43 años, vive con sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender ropa, repartiendo mediante visitas a sus vecinos y personas que conoce y son de confianza para darles crédito. Generalmente sale por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas está pendiente de sus hijos. Adicionalmente, hace varios meses atrás que empezó a vender leche azada, que es un postre típico de su zona y también lo vende de forma ambulante. Jaqueline se prepara para largos días de caminata, pero este esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, en las ganancias que obtiene para el sostenimiento de su familia. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, es una integrante de su banco comunal muy activa, la que siempre incentiva a la unidad en el trabajo, y se siente útil de servir de esa manera. Con el dinero de su préstamo comprará más mercadería, en especial pantalones.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 43 years old, and lives with her 3 children in their own house. For the past 3 years, she has been selling clothing during visits to her neighbors and people who she knows and with whom she has the trust to let them buy on credit. She generally goes out in the afternoons, since in the morning she is taking care of her children. Additionally, a couple months ago she began to sell leche azada, which is a traditional dessert of the region. Jaqueline prepares herself for long days of walking, but this effort has its payback in the money that she obtains to sustain her family. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from MFP, and she is a very active member of the community bank who always tries to unify people, and she feels very useful to serve in this way. With the money, she plans to buy more clothing, especially pants.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Ra Chhean Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of twenty members located in Sdau Kanleng village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Ra C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs. Ra C. is 35 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to study. Her husband, Mr. D. Sorin, is a construction foreman. Mrs. Ra C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow mangos; however her field is infertile, which has an impact on her crop. In order to solve this problE., she needs to buy fertilizer to increase crop production, so has asked for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her mango growing business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
"I am the tenant of a one-hectare farm. My husband and I work to save money to buy our own farm. I wish that we will always have an abundant harvest. We really wish we could send all our children to school and provide them all their needs," says Marieta G., 38, and mother of four children.

She requests a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, Urea and certified seeds. The loan will truly help the couple improve their harvest and income.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides loans, training and insurance coverage to its clients.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, Urea and certified seeds.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est âgée de 54 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de la couture et vends des draps et des habits. Elle aimerait avec ce prêt augmenter ses revenus pour mieux subvenir aux charges familiales dont elle fait face.
texts.en:
Fatoumata K., age 43, is a widow and the mother of five children. She is a seamstress and sells bed sheets and clothing. She would like to use this loan to increase her revenues to cover the family expenses which she is facing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sew bed sheets and clothing to sell

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia T., 55, is married with six children. She has two years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the village people and public four days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~75 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Sesilia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used for business purposes only. The business is running well with the support of her children and husband.

loans.use: To purchase knives, a ranging pole, a spade and a crowbar

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (1403030015) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business venture manufacturing & selling mattresses to local business and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire R. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 18 years old. Claire is single. To make a living, Claire owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Claire is just starting this business.

In 2009, Claire joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claire is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Claire from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba tiene 34 años, es una mujer soltera muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hermana y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Su negocio es la venta de anticuchos (brochetas), los cuales prepara desde la tarde para venderlos llegada las 7 de la noche. Sus ventas son en la calle, de forma ambulante y cuando empieza a vender sus platillos, su carretilla se llena y es muy concurrida, ya que sus clientes saben que Elba tiene una sazón muy especial para cocinar los anticuchos, ya sean de carne de pollo o salchicha, todo depende del gusto del cliente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y atenderlos de la mejor manera, lleva 6 meses en esta actividad, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de artesanías, negocio que dejó de lado por un tiempo por su baja demanda. Elba considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que quedarse vendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche y para el futuro espera retomar su negocio de las artesanías, ya que con ese ingreso económico desea poner una tienda más grande de anticuchos donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. 
Este es el quinto préstamo al que accede y tiene buenos antecedentes en MFP de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, y eso lo saben bien los miembros de su banco comunal, es por ese motivo que confían en ella. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una nueva parrilla para los anticuchos, además cambiará las llantas de su triciclo porque ya están gastadas

loans.use: Compra de una nueva parrilla

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en: This group loan is for two low-income people. Its leader, Tho L., 57, is a single mother who is blessed with six children. One of her sons works in construction and provides his little income for the family. Tho L. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She currently owns a small trade; she sells beef soup for villagers at the evening. To make a daily additional income, she is looking for a loan as capital to order bamboo baskets in bulk from weavers and then re-sell to raise profits. The other borrower is Mrs. Sos P., 24, a basket maker, who is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials.

loans.use: To order bamboo baskets in bulk from weavers

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn N. is from the village of Bongabong,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Emelyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Emelyn owns & operates a business selling soft drinks in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,050.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Emelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Towards working capital and to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been in a small retail business in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 27 years old, married to George Kimani, and has three school-age children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan and she plans to use it to add more goods for her store. In the future, she plans to build rental houses on the piece of land that she already owns.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To add more goods to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Fatou Efa

texts.fr: Fatou Efa Sané est âgée de 57 ans elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 6 ans et demi, elle y a reçu 11 prêts qui lui ont permis jusqu'à aujourd'hui de développer une activité de vente de crème glacée. Elle participe activement à la prise en charge des dépenses quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Efa Sané is 57 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for 6½ years and has received from it eleven loans, which enabled her thus far to develop her business selling ice cream. She participates actively in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
A. Mariya is 50 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is a widow and has two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was young, the significant value of work and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Mariya dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. The income she generates provides a better quality of life for her family. She is asking for a loan of $1200 US in order to buy calves to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, Mariya will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Docas

texts.en:
Docas is married with three children and she is 30 years old. Her eldest child is 10 years old. Her husband is an electrician. All her children are excelling in school.

She fries and sells garri (cassava flakes) at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. Garri is gotten from cassava and it is a staple food in Nigeria. Docas lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cassava to fry as garri and then sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora María De La Luz A. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y desea vender artículos de navidad, pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Solicita un préstamo, ya que es una buena temporada para las ventas.
Planea pagar el crédito una parte de las ganancias, ya que pronto será madre, y quiere darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
María De La Luz has been selling new and used clothing for more than four years. Her business needs a greater variety of merchandise and she would like to sell some Christmas items as well, but she lacks the capital she needs to invest in additional merchandise. She is asking for a loan now that sales are good. She plans to repay the loan with part of her earnings. She will be a mother soon and wants to provide the best for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in additional merchandise

loans.name: Milagro De Jesús

texts.es: Milagro D. Jesús G. D. M. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa María, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y un nieto. Ella posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Milagros ha luchado mucho por tener su negocio a flote, surtiéndola poco a poco con lo que ella ha podido. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería como leche, bebidas y otra cantidad D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad. Milagro junto a su esposo trabajando arduamente para poder seguir adelante, así mismo velando por el bienestar D. su nieto el cual ha estado a cargo D. ellos desD. muy pequeño. Este negocio es D. mucha importancia para milagro ya que es D. este del cual ella espera depender en su vejez, es por ello que desea surtirlo y D. esta manera poder mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Milagro D. Jesus is 46 years old and lives in Santa Maria, which is located in the province of Usulutan. She lives with her husband and their grandson. Milagro has a small shop located in her house. She has fought hard to keep her business afloat, stocking the store little by little with what she could. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory such as milk, drinks, and other household staples. Milagro and her husband work arduously to improve the quality of life and well being of their grandson, who has been in their care since he was very young. This business is very important to Milagro and she counts on it for her later years. The loan will help her to expand her inventory and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store, such as milk, drinks and other household staples.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon H. is 49 years old and lives in Prey Snoul village in Takeo Province. She is a village bank president of a group of 17 members. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.
Mrs. Yon H. is a mother of three children, all of whom are students. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Although Mrs. Yon H. and her husband work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. Therefore, Mrs. Yon H. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding, and pig food, so that she can start a new business.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 42 years old and married with two grown children, ages 27 and 24. He is a farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley in Kenya. He's been farming for 25 years and sells tea leaves through the Kenya Tea Development Authority and milk to the local community. He says that the main challenges to his business are a lack of capital and the limited size of his farm.

Joel successfully completed a previous loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 35,000 to purchase another dairy cow. The additional cow with increase his milk sales and overall income. In the future, he hopes to purchase more land and expand to start also selling cows. He says that he wants to work hard to improve his livelihood and ensure his family's food security.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una abnegada madre de 36 años, vive en compañía de su pareja Manuel, de 35 años, y con sus dos hijas: Adriana de 5 y Araiza de tan solo 3 meses de nacida. 

Ella está muy feliz porque a pesar de haber tenido recientemente a su bebé puede dedicarle tiempo a su trabajo, ya que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 9 años y esto le ha permitido disponer libremente de sus horarios.

Algunas veces, Dina lleva a su pequeña y se siente muy contenta de estar con ella y a la vez generar dinero para su hogar.

Para el futuro, Dina quiere instalar un bazar, negocio que espera le sea mucho más rentable, ya que le gusta mucho ayudar en la economía familiar y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad con todos sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más cosméticos para vender en esta época de verano, ya que los perfumes, desodorantes y cremas para el cuidado de la piel son muy solicitados.
texts.en:
Dina is a selfless mother who is 36 years old. She lives with her partner Manuel, who is 35, and her two daughters: Adriana, 5 and Araiza, only 3 months. She is very happy because despite having had her baby very recently she can dedicate time to her work. She has been selling beauty products for 9 years and this has allowed her to set her own schedule. Sometimes, she takes her little one and she feels very happy to be with her and at the same time make money for her household. For the future, Dina wants to set up a store. This will be more profitable. She likes helping in the family finances and supporting her husband with the household expenses. This is the fifth loan with MFP and she has always shown a lot of responsibility with all of her payments, the same as the other members of the group. With the money she is asking for now, she will buy more cosmetics to sell this summer, since perfumes, deodarants and skincare creams are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta N. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Julieta is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julieta is just starting this business. Previously Julieta had a fruit vending business and managed a  video karaoke business in their village.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcelino Jose

texts.pt:
Marcelino José C. nasceu na cidade de pemba, Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique tem 59 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 18 e 15 anos de idade, todos vã a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe e parou quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Pomba para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar, e depois de reformar não voltou mais para sua terra natal. Ė Pensionista do Ministério da Defesa Nacional a mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e recebe uma pensão mensal de 4.089.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua casa.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do chefe do seu bairro. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, blocos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra de construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.200.00mt para a mesma actividade.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelino José C. was born in the city of Pemba, Cabo Delgado Province, in northern Mozambique. He is 59 years old, married, and father to two children, ages 18 and 15. Both go to school. Marcelino only finished fourth grade and quit when he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his nieces and nephews, who live with him. Marcelino left Pemba for Maputo while completing his military service, and after his discharge he did not return to the land of his birth. He has received a pension from the National Defense Ministry for more than ten years. He has no employees and receives a monthly pension of 4,089 meticais, which he uses for household expenses and sometimes saves some money at home. Marcelino has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through the head of his neighborhood. This is his second loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron, blocks, sand and other materials) to keep building his home. The previous loan was for 7,200 meticais and was used for the same purpose. In the future, he wants to ask for more loans so he can continue building his house and can furnish it. For this reason, he promises to pay off this loan promptly.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, iron, blocks, sand and other materials)

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita L. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Elita operates a retail store selling fruit like mangoes and apples. Elita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Elita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.es:
Laxmi tiene 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres al lado de su esposo Ronald (25), que es agricultor y de sus 2 hijos menores.

Desde hace 2 años instaló una tienda de venta de repuestos para autos y camiones, algo singular en la zona donde vive (selva central). Pero el tiempo le demostró que era un buen negocio, ya que en poco tiempo ha crecido bastante y ahora puede ofrecer diversidad de repuestos a sus habituales clientes que la buscan ante cualquier problema de sus autos. El trabajo es tranquilo, ya que está ubicado en su casa y mientras lo atiende no descuida la crianza de sus hijos, además como es el único negocio de su tipo por la zona donde vive, las ganancias que le genera son buenas. Así, mientras su esposo siembra frutas, ella se dedica por entero a la venta de los repuestos. A pesar de su juventud Laxmi tiene muchos planes para el futuro, entre ellos ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de repuestos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice que su grupo comunal es uno de los más organizados, pues todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. 

Laxmi tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos para abastecer su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laxmi is 22 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her husband Ronald (age 25), who is a farmer, and their two young children.

Two years ago, Laxmi opened a store selling spare parts for cars and trucks. This type of product is unique in the area where she lives (in the central jungle). However, time has proven that hers is a good business because it has grown significantly. She now offers a variety of parts because she has regular customers who come to her whenever they need to fix a problem with their cars. Her work is peaceful because her business is located in her home, which also allows her to look after her children. Her business also generates good revenue because it is the only one of its kind in the area. Meanwhile her husband works as a fruit farmer while she devotes all of her time to her parts business. Despite her young age, Laxmi has many plans for the future, including expanding her business and offering a wider variety of parts.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. Laxmi says her Communal Bank is one of the most organized groups. In addition, all the members are punctual when submitting their payments. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of a large quantity of spare parts so that she can restock her business and offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to increase her inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en:
