A determined and hardworking K. John is vibrant-sounding in terms of business and agriculture enterprises in Kakungu village, Ntungamo. He deals in poultry farming and supplies trays of eggs to hotels and shop vendors and also owns a banana plantation. All that generates income for his family.

John’s main drawback has been lack of funding to purchase feed for his poultry and mulches for his plantations and this has reduced his yields. Therefore, with a loan, he will be able to improve his yields of milk, eggs and bananas, thus enabling him to meet his customers’ high demand. It will also increase his sales revenue, hence making him more able to meet his family requirements such as tuition fees for his children and enable him to live a more self-sustaining life. He will use the loan to buy more poultry feeds and mulch his plantations.

loans.use: To purchasing fertilizer and more poultry feed

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia S. is 56 and a happy person who enjoys life, especially since she joined ASHI in 2009. Apart from being able to receive a loan through ASHI, the opportunity to meet and interact with other members is what she enjoys the most. Married to a farmer, life is never easy because farming requires a huge amount of capital for maintenance and sustainability. Aside from the finances needed by the business she supports the family of her child, who is also poor. Despite that, Alicia is happy because her family members never stop loving and cooperating with one another to rise above poverty. Through a loan from ASHI, Alicia is the one who supports her husband’s sugar-cane farming business. Her son helps her husband in farming. Once sugar cane is harvested, her husband and son will have it processed to produce a muscovado (red) sugar. Alicia sells this bio-organic and natural sugar per kilo in the market. Proceeds are used to support her family and some will be re-invested to the business in addition to the loan she requests.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to cultivate the soil and plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en: Rovelyn A. is from the village of Manamong. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rovelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rovelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rovelyn is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother with three children, two attending school, and one who is too young for school. She has been selling secondhand clothes door-to-door for four years.

With this loan, she wants to buy a bundle of secondhand clothes and shoes to sell in the neighboring community. In this business, Susan faces the challenges associated with seasonality. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and supply more to the market.

Susan currently lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. She pointed out that food is her greatest monthly expense. She decided to join Yehu in order to get a loan and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of secondhand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn T. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental Province.  Rosalyn is 32, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Rosalyn owns and operates a boarding  houses for students in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn is requesting her first loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to fund her business. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital for the operation of a boarding house for students.

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es:
Julia tiene 44 años y es conviviente, ambos confeccionan ropa. Ella tiene una bodega en el mercado D. la zona J D. Huaycán, venD. verduras y legumbres desD. hace más D. 15 años. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. En un día normal ella atienD. aproximadamente 20 clientes en su negocio y le gustaría que Edaprospo realice más capacitaciones para tener más capital y ser capaz D. ampliar más su negocio.
Florina  tiene 43 años y es conviviente, tiene un comedor desD. hace 2 años. Preocupada por ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, tuvo esta idea.
Ella sirve en el almuerzo y desayuno y normalmente atienD. 50 platos en un día, utiliza sus préstamos para comprar el arroz y otras cosas para la cocina. Dice que es una gran ayuda para ella y que hace 4 años que trabaja con Edaprospo, además quisiera tener más talleres D. capacitación y aprender a cómo mejorar el servicio para sus clientes.
Sonia tiene 40 años, es separada y venD. ropa en el Mercado Central D. Huaycán ya desD. hace 8 años. Ella tiene su propio local y trabaja sola. Al principio vendía solamente juguetes pero ahora tiene más cosas como jeans, polos, chompas, etc. Le gustaría ampliar su negocio y tener más clientes porque en este momento solo atienD. 3 clientes por día.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old and lives with her partner. They both make clothing. She has a small stO. in the market in the J zone of Huaycán. She has been selling vegetables for mO. than 15 years. Her business has grown bit by bit. In a normal day she tends to approximately 20 customers in her business. She would like for Edaprospo to do mO. trainings so she could have mO. capital and be able to expand her business mO.. Florina is 43 years old and lives with her partner. She has had a small restaurant for the past 2 years. She got the idea to have this business because she was worried about being able to help her children with their studies. She serves breakfast and lunch and usually serves 50 meals per day. She uses her loans to buy the rice and other things for the kitchen. She says it is a big help for her and that she has been working with Edaprospo for 4 years. She would also like to have mO. training workshops and learn how to proviD. better service to her customers. Sonia is 40 years old and is separated. She has been selling clothing in the Central Market of Huaycán for 8 years. She has her own stO. and works on her own. At first she only sold toys, but now she has mO. things likes jeans, polo shirts, sweaters, etc. She would like to expand her business and have mO. customers because right now she only has about 3 customers per day.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and ingredients

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido C. Jr. is from the village of Cabanatian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 32 years old. Candido is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Candido owns & operates a business making & selling specialty food products like home-made sausage, or longganisa, in the local community. Candido has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Candido joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Candido has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Candido is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items or machines to expand the product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Candido from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items or machines to expand product offering.

loans.name: Rucelinda

texts.en:
Rucelinda D. is a 27 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 businesses: seaweed culture, fishing and dried fish sales. She lives in Tinago, Brgy. Doong, Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her seaweed culture, fishing and dried fish businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Rucelinda is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and seaweed equipment. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rucelinda hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase of fishing gear and seaweed equipment

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah E. goes to the market to buy maize and sells it in both small and large quantities at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and responsibly takes care of seven dependents.

Theresah’s loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a member of Omwando group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been farming for eight years in Kisii town in western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, milk, and nappier grass, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his kiosk in the same area. Tom is 28 years old and married with one child who is six months old.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi of 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him improve the livelihood of his family. In the future, he aspires to acquire a piece of land and expand his dairy farming and also expand his kiosk business. His biggest challenges are lack of enough financing to buy farm inputs (e.g., fertilizers) and changes in weather that affect his production.

He is grateful to Juhudi for implementing these rural-based projects to help the poor improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Edna is married and has eight children. Her eldest is 28 years old and the youngest is 9. To make a living, Edna raises crops. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice. Edna also plans to raise hogs for fattening and sale. 

Edna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid her previous loan. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to purchase farming items, feed, and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farming items, feed, and piglets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is currently in the business of making tea and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Grace is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a doctor. She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Mayte

texts.es:
Mayte vive en la casa de sus abuelos cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona ciudad satélite. Ella tiene una tienda de barrio ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella no tiene hijos, vive con sus abuelos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Abarrotes como azúcar, arroz y fideo. Esto le permitirá aumentar su capital y ofrecer los productos a sus clientes.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico permite ver que Mayte está calificada para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Mayte lives at her grandparents’ house which is located in an area adjacent to the city of El Alto. She manages a neighborhood store in her home. This is the main source of income by which she supports herself. Mayte does not have children and lives with her grandparents.

The loan will be used to buy groceries such as sugar, rice, and noodles. This will enable her to increase her capital and offer products to her customers. Mayte is receiving her first loan from IMPRO and the socio-economic analysis indicates that she is qualified to receive this loan.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and noodles

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 18 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  Aisha has a business of selling fish, which she has had for one year.   To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase fish.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to expand her business.  

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Donakhon

texts.en: A. Donakhon is 29 years old. She is married with three children. For 12 years, Donakhon has worked as a market vendor. She is selling the plates and dishes of the oriental style in the central local market. This kind of goods is of popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for the dowry of the girls and also for the family celebrations. The love for her children is the biggest reason for Donakhon to make an effort to provide what they need. Now Donakhon is planning to enlarge the range of goods. With this purpose, she requests 10,000 Somoni. Donakhon has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006. Her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. Donakhon and her children are sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing plates and dishes of the oriental style in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Yolanda is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles and snack foods in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta Julia M.: es Soltera Tiene 57 años 4 hijos todos mayores de edad,su negocio lo inicio hace 38 años vendiendo dulces y chicles, en la puerta de su casa asi vendio un tiempo despues con el tiempo empeso a vender frutas, refacciones, en le mismo lugar despues puso su tienda la cual yamo tienda Tita, en ella vende productos comestibles,como arroz,frijol,entre otros en sus tiempos libres lo ocupa confeccionando prendas ya que la han catalogado como una de las mejores confeccionistas en el area donde vive, el prestamo que ella solicita es para compra de productos comestibles,su sueño es que su hija se gradue de la Univercidad y en un futuro invertir en productos para libreria.
texts.en:
Marta Julia M. is single.  She is 57 years old and has four grown-up children.  She started her business 38 years ago, selling candy and gum from the door of her home.  This is how she made her sales for some time.

Over time, Marta started to sell fruit and snacks.  She later set up a store in her home which she called "Tienda Tita".  There she sells food products such as rice, beans, etc.  In her spare time she makes clothes as she is rated as one of the best dressmakers in her area.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy food products.  Her dream is for her daughter to graduate from university and, in the future, to invest in products for a bookstore.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Khalida Shoqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a wife of S. A. and lives in the Pakistani city of Kasur, famous for its tanneries industry. She owns a two-roomed house and lives in it with her family. A very caring lady, Khalida stays at home and manages her household work. She is also known in her community for her good hospitable nature. She feels happy to serve people.
Khalida's husband is also a very good-natured man. He is involved in a business selling sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes etc. He also offers customers sanitary fitting services. He is a very experienced man who has been in this profession for many years. He has a shop in the market where people approach him to buy sanitary supplies and fit them at their houses.
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes etc in larger quantities to sell in his shop. Khalida is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband’s business will be expanded and earn him maximum profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies (such as taps and water pipes) for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Hean Soknoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who make up a village bank loan live in Veay Chhneah village, Takeo province. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their families. 

Mrs. Hean S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She owns a general shore in the local village where she sells groceries to get some profit to support her family. She also is a pig breeder. 

Her husband, Mr. Sroun Kong, is a motorbike taxi driver in Phnom Penh city. Through this activity, they support two children, one of whom is a student. The younger one is 2 years old.

Since her businesses are getting on well, Mrs. Hean S. wants to expand, so she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries and the rest of the loan she is going use to buy more pig food.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Helmer

texts.es: Helmer, es un joven trabajador que vive junto a su esposa Elizabeth, en casa de su mamá, ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace 3 años que se independizó y el puesto que adquirió a orillas del puente, le sirvieron para instalar una tienda de venta de pollo, donde vende un promedio de 14 a 15 pollos diarios; paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la construcción de casas como albañil; realizando así jornadas de trabajo de acuerdo al tiempo que dura la construcción de las mismas. Pero su esposa Elizabeth también le ayuda con la venta de tamales, los días domingos, donde hay más afluencia de visitantes, ya que en el Puente Paucartambo da pasó a tres ciudades. Ahora él desea comprar su propia casa y de esa manera consolidar su familia.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde es uno de los socios activos de su asociación. Helmer, se está preparando para la campaña agrícola de café, ya que en esa temporada se duplican sus ventas de pollo; por ello con el crédito comprará una gran cantidad de pollos de corral.
texts.en:
Helmer is a hardworking young man. He lives with his wife Elizabeth at his mother’s house located in Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle). Three years ago, he became independent and acquired a vending stall at the edge of a bridge. There he opened a shop where he sells an average of 14 to 15 chickens each day. In addition to his business, he builds houses as a mason. He works on construction projects based on when his services are required. His wife also helps by selling tamales on Sundays because there are more visitors since the Paucartambo Bridge leads to three cities. Now he wants to buy a house of his own so that his family will be strengthened.

Helmer belongs to the Communal Bank “Comerciantes” (Merchants) and is receiving his third loan from MFP. He is one of the active members of his group. Helmer is preparing for the coffee season because his chicken sales double during this time. For this reason, he will purchase a large quantity of farm-raised chickens.

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 61 years-old. Lydia is a widow with five adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Lydia joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy K. has been in the fishing business for a long time. He and his wife always take their boat toward the middle of the river every morning, and then catch fish. When the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers. Tuy K. and his wife also support their six single children, all of whom still live under their care. The family typically makes around $7 of profit each day to ensure that they have a comfortable standard of living. Tuy K. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase nets and other fishing implements

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, es una abnegada madre de familia, que vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en las afueras de la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Desde las primeras horas del día comienza a vender los ricos pasteles que prepara un día antes. Según menciona vende un promedio de 4 pasteles en total, obteniendo ganancias considerables. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es amasar la harina,  “pues ahí está el secreto de un buen pastel”, afirma. Como en la zona donde vive no existe muchos comercios ni pastelerías, le es rentable la venta de los pasteles que prepara, pero es consiente que la falta de capital de trabajo la limita. Por ello está trabajando con ahínco  para poder ahorrar lo necesario y así comprar un horno artesanal con el que podrá elaborar además de tortas, panecillos y demás bocaditos a base de harina. “Todo esto lo realizó para poder darle una buena educación a mis hijos”, menciona. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La brisas”, y este es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe constantemente. Esther, en está campaña de cosecha de café, vende más tortas por lo que comprará con el crédito solicitado, insumos como harina, huevos y mantequilla, en grandes cantidades para la elaboración de más tortas.
texts.en:
Esther is a selfless mother. She lives with her children and husband on the outskirts of the city of San Ramón in the central Peruvian jungle. From the early hours of the morning, she begins selling her rich cakes that she prepared the day before. Esther says that she sells an average of four cakes, which generate considerable earnings. What she enjoys most about her work is mixing the batter. “This is the secret to making a good cake,” Esther claims. There are hardly any shops or bakeries in her area, so selling the cakes she prepares is quite profitable. However, the lack of capital limits her work. For this reason, she is working hard to save enough money to buy an artisan oven for making cakes, buns, and other baked goods. Esther says, “I do all I can to provide my children with a good education.”

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes) and this is her seventh loan with MFP. Esther is grateful for the support she constantly receives. During the coffee harvesting season, she sells more cakes. For this reason, the loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as flour, eggs, and butter in large quantities for making cakes.

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, and butter for making cakes.

loans.name: Emmaneul

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 29-year-old man. He is single and has adopted an orphan.
He has been a motorbike taxi driver for one year. He transports people from 5 am until 11 pm. He currently has to rent a motorbike. 
Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva Lenders and Vision Finance Company in order to purchase his own motorbike.
Emmanuel will use the profits from his motorbike taxi to help his family and build a house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi L. is a 32-year-old husband and father of one son.  Fadi and his partner have a small restaurant in the city of Ramallah and they want to launch another branch in Bethlehem city.

Fadi took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the items and ingredients needed to start up the restaurant services which will be launched in the coming few days.

Fadi who appears in the picture here wants to increase the profits that are divided between two partners.

loans.use: to purchase the food and ingredients necessary to launch his restaurant.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
Vicentina nació en la comunidad de Arin provincia de Calca del departamento Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposa y en su propia casa junto con sus cuatro hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.  

Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive, han sido en la vida de Vicentina un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja, que con mucho esmero siembran maíz. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Ella nos cuenta que comprar ganado de la feria de Inquilpata y los hace engordar y después vienen a su casa carniceros para comprar su ganado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de aledañas. 

Vicentina solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar producción. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 500 nuevos soles, comprará chanchos.
texts.en:
Vicentina was born in the community of Arin in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco, Perú. She is 40 years old, and is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives with her spouse in their own house with they four children, which motivate all of their efforts.

Vicentina finds the green farms in the Arin, which is located in Valle Sagrado de los Incas, to be a very nice place to work. Since she was young, her parents taught her this work, and now she has her own land where she carefully grows corn. She also raises livestock. Vicentina buys cattle in the fair in Inquilpata, and fattens them. Then, butchers come to her house to buy the cattle. What she likes most about this work is to sow the land, since this hard work brings her must satisfaction. She has spent many years pursuing this activity, and she thinks that the most difficult thing to transporting her crops to the central markets in far-away cities.

Vicentina requests this loan to help her achieve her goal of increasing production. She will make her repayments punctually, and she must do this if she wants to take out another loan. She is thankful for the institution for granting her the loan. With these 500 nuevos soles, she will buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Cruz De Espinas Group

texts.es:
Yaneth Felicia tiene 27 años de edad socia de la alcancía comunal Cruz de Espinas, es madre soltera su hijo de 4 años de edad, vive en la localidad de  Matahuasi  Huancayo, Yaneth desde muy pequeña quedaron huérfanos con su hermano César conflicto del Terror del Terrorismo en  Perú en los años 90, desde entonces de su niñez tuvieron que trabajar cuidando ganado ajeno de los vecinos de la zona, trabajaron y se esforzaron mucho y actualmente ya tienen sus propios ganados y desean incrementar para engorde. El Préstamo que solicita  es para la compra de Alimentos Balanceados para sus ganados vacunos. La socia esta en la segunda fila la cuarta persona lado derecha con chompa color morado. 
El Préstamo es de s/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles
texts.en:
Yaneth Felicia is 27 years old and a member of the “Cruz de Espinas” (Cross of Thorns) communal bank.  She is a single mother of a 4-year-old son.  She lives in Matahuasi, Huancayo. 

Yaneth and her brother César were orphaned while still very little due to the rampant terrorism in Perú in the 90s.  Since their childhood they had to work caring for cattle belonging to nearby neighbors.  They worked hard and put much effort into their work and they currently own cattle of their own.  They want to increase the size of their herd to raise and fatten up.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.  

She appears in the second row, fourth person on the right wearing a purple sweater.

The loan is for 500 new soles.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a farmer working in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She is still single. Hazel tills her own land where she grows rice and corn crops. She works hard to support her family financially. She also wants to save for her future family.

Hazel has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Dropati

texts.en:
Dropati is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 25 and 22. In 1998, she established her poultry business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase small chicks for her business.  

In the future, Dropati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buys small chicks

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet, 49, is married and earns a living to support her family by selling soup in her community. Her husband is a carpenter. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Tuyet has sold soup for five years. She plans to use this loan to buy meat and rice to make soup and to purchase wood and other materials for her husband to make furniture. In the future, she would like to expand her business by opening her own food stall and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat and rice to make soup and materials for her husband to make furniture.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena, 33, lives in the Philippines and is married with five children. She peddles snacks such as rice and cassava cakes, which she has been doing for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Ma. Elena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 30 years old, married to Mary and they have one child. He has operated in the transport industry for the last seven years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to repair his motorbike and also boost his farming project. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and boost his farming project

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is 56 years old and a dairy farmer.  He is married to Joyce. They are blessed with two children, aged 17 and 15 years respectively.  He has been a dairy farmer for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Zachary will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will build a cow pen. 

His hopes and dreams are to start a green house, which will increase his savings and thus improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es: El Sr. Ronal vive en una urbanización nueva recién construida en donde ha alquilado una casa en la cual ha puesto su negocio de bazar y ademas brinda alquiler de video juegos, el cliente tiene también un auto en el cual hace movilidad escolar tiene un hijo a su cargo en cual esta estudiando y también lo ayuda en el negocio. Solicita el crédito en nuestra institución ya que quiere adquirir mas televisores para sus videos juegos. Además tiene un terreno en el cual piensa construir. El señor Ronal es una persona muy trabajadora con muchos deseos de tener un mejor nivel de vida. Su sueño es poder construir su casa propia de material noble. El esta muy agradecido por credito otorgado ya que contribuye a ser crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Mr. Ronal lives in a newly built residential area where he has rented a house.  There he has set up a bazaar and also rents videogames.  He also uses his car to transport school children.  He has a school-aged son in his care who helps out in the business.  The loan he is requesting from our institution will be used to buy more TV sets for the videogames.  He also has land where he wants to start construction.  Mr. Ronal is a hard-working person who has a great desire to lead a better lifestyle.  His dream is to build his own house out of cement and stone.  He is very grateful for the loan which will help expand his business.

loans.use: To buy TV sets for his videogames business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware store items

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Jane takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for her family and to have enough money to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant between ½ and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Jane is pictured with her group members, with her field officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 72 years old . She is widowed with 4 children.  Pedrita has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has had this business for ten years. 

Pedrita requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.  She is a new member of Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI).  In the future, Pedrita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Sandra tiene 55 años, ella tiene el negocio de venta de nacatamales, mini pulpería y elaboración de güirilas, inicio hace 8 años este negocio fue con el tiempo que empezó a vender estos productos y al ver la buena afluencia de clientes decide seguir adelante con este medio de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de maíz, hojas, bolsas, leña, comal, entre otros productos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y mejorar cada día más el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra is 55 years old.  She has a business where she sells tamales, has a mini general store, and makes corn pancakes.  She started this business 8 years ago and  began to sell these products, and when she saw the influx of customers, she decided to continue moving ahead with this means of living.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of corn, leaves for wrapping the tamales, bags, and firewood, among other things.

Her goal is to expand her business and each day improve her customer service.

loans.use: to buy corn, leaves for wrapping tamales, bags, and firewood among other things.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 40 is a hairdresser. She has been doing her business for six years and already has her own permanent customers. She is divorced and now lives with her daughter, a university student, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Oyuncimeg wants to renovate her work tools, clippers, and other equipment for her barbershop because they have become old and have some damage to them lately. 

Therefore, Oyunchimeg is taking out a loan to purchase the new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.use: To purchase new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.name: Francisco Cesar

texts.es:
Francisco vive con su esposa y tres hijos, es casado, tiene una venta de sorbete al mayoreo y cuenta con un vehículo para la distribución de ello en diferentes pueblos, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar la venta.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como lo son sorbetes y paletas, esta compra le permitirá aumentar su capital de venta, el cual le ayudara también a aumentar las ganancias económicas.
Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia y levantar el negocio ya que había decaído.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He sells wholesale sherbet and has a vehicle for distributing his product in different towns.  He doesn't have an established schedule for his sales.
Francisco is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise, such as sherbet and popsicles.  These purchases will increase his business capital, which will help him to increase his profits.
Francisco's greatest dream is to have his own house and to raise up his business, since it had declined.

loans.use: to purchase sherbets and popsicles.

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en:
Sorphea (in the photo) is single and lives with her widowed mother in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sorphea sells clothes. She buys clothes from the market located in Phnom Penh and sells them in front of the garment factory. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Hugo Fernando

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 21 años, padre de una niña de tres años. Vive junto a su pareja y su hija en Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo es una ciudad ecuatoriana, capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Con una población de 305.632 habitantes en 2010 es la cuarta ciudad más poblada del Ecuador, después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca. Santo Domingo se ubica entre la Región Costa y la Región Interandina, por eso, es punto de enlace entre algunas ciudades importantes. Su principal atractivo es la naturaleza, dotada de una alta biodiversidad, en una variedad de ecosistemas que se extienden en una zona con un alto índice de especies endémicas, considerada por científicos ambientales como laboratorio para la investigación genética mundial.

Hugo heredó de sus padres la finca donde reside con su familia. Para vivir cultiva la tierra mientras su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar y a su pequeña hija. Desea hacer mejoras a su vivienda por lo que necesita un crédito. De esta manera él quiere que su familia viva de mejor. Para pagar su crédito él seguirá en las tareas del campo y así poder sacar adelante su proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 21-year-old man and the father of a 3-year-old daughter.  He lives with his spouse and daughter in Santo Domingo.  Santo Domingo is an Ecuadorean city, the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province.  

With a population of 305,632 inhabitants in 2010 it is the fourth most populated city in Ecuador after Guayaquil, Quito and Cuenca.  Santo Domingo is located between the Coastal and Inter-Andean Regions so it’s an important communication hub between some important cities.  Its main draw is its natural environment dotted with high biodiversity in a variety of ecosystems that extend in a zone with a high index of native species considered by environmental scientists as a laboratory to study world genetics.

Hugo inherited from his parents the farm he lives on with his family.  To live, he farms the land while his wife tends to household chores and to their little girl.  He wants to do some home improvements and this is why he needs the loan. In this way, he wants his family to live better.  To repay the loan he will continue working in the fields to thus move his life project forward.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho que ainda frequenta a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 21 anos no mercado chissano e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (pedra, cimento, blocos, ferro, e outro). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 21.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e fazer crescer o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has a son who still attends school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman at the Chissano market for over 21 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her home (stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 21.000mt, for the same purpose.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her home and to expand her business. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her home (stone, cement, cinder blocks, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en:
Ayishatu is a petty trader. She trades in food such as kako (salted fish), perrer, salt, etc.  

Ayishatu is married to a farmer and has six children. She assists her husband in paying utility bills and with the upkeep of their children  

Ayishatu will uses this loan to purchase more food items for sale. With the new profit, Ayishatu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items for sale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is 49 years old, he is married to Aurea, who is 37 years old. Together they have children. They have their own house where they live happily. Since he was a child his parents taught him to work on the farm, now he is a farmer and he has his own land where he grows crops like corn and rice. He has been working his own land for the past 15 years. During harvest times he has help from his children and other hired laborers to be able to pick the more quickly. What he likes most about his work is harvesting his plants because he can see that his months of hard work have resulted in the reward of good crops. The hardest thing is to transport his products from the farm to the warehouse that is located in the city of Ilagan province of Isabela; this is where he is able to get the best price for his crops. His difficulty is that he does not have enough economic income to be able to cover the advance payments to the hired laborers that help him during the harvest. It is for this reason that he asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seed and payments for hired laborer. Miguel feels that the money from this loan will help him greatly in the progress of his work.

loans.use: to buy corn seed,fertilizer and payments for hired laborers for his farming business

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa is a forty-four-year-old woman who lives with her daughter in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her daughter is sick at home and her husband died many years ago. She has been running a business retailing milk products since 2000. She started selling other foods in 2008. She orders the goods from the capital city. She has been retailing the goods at the local market.  She has a further plan to develop business activities such as getting the supplies in large amounts and selling them at the regular price. By getting the loan, she could expand the business activity. 

Baigalmaa is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business to raise my income and save for my daughter's future." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase food products.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a sus difentes negocios como venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz y atmbien vende productos de belleza y sigue ofreciendo servicios de telefonia,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora y por medio de estos pequeño negocios le va muy bien y puede sacar adelante a sus hijos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz al por mayor para que prepare la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

loans.use: La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz al por mayor para que prepare la chicha.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 6 Group

texts.en:
Jemima is 35 years old, married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Jemima runs a buy and sell cloths in the Teshi localities. She and her counterparts in the group called 'Ekome feemo' has requested a  loan of 4500 GHS through ID-Ghana,where she will use her loan portion of 2000 GHS to buy additional cloths to satisfy the customers demands.

Jemima has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from ID-Ghana. She has been running her business buying and selling cloth for 10 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and direct selling.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cloths to satisfy the customers demands.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married woman with a five children.  This is a business oriented woman who believes in achieving her goals.
 
She started by selling produce e.g. Maize, Millet, Sorghum, Rice, Groundnuts, Pease from WITEP worth $200 that helped her to increase her stock.
 
Given a loan   of $1,000, she plans to expand her business by opening up a store in Mbale Town in order meet the middle man with her produce.  She will increase the quantity and quality of each item that, she sells.
 
This is a woman of high dignity who is able to refund the loan money without any problem.

loans.use: Increasing the stock of produce, opening a store in Mbale Town.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar was born in 1956 in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. She is married , has a child.
Gulzar supports her family by working as a cook. She likes international cousine but National dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favourite ones.
You can see in the picture woman, who prepares our National dish khingal.
The first loan amount of $600 she spent to buy kitchen appliances 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to  increase her incomes via diversifying the menu.

loans.use: To increase her incomes via diversifying the menu

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame M. is a resident. She smokes fish and sells it in the market herself. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $800.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Miss Ngoc is 35 years old. Her husband died of a brain hemorrhage 3 years ago. She is supporting two children by herself. She doesn’t have any land for cultivation. Ngoc suffers from spinal column, stomach and sinus problems.

Ngoc’s selling fish sauce and dried fish at her house is thus important to increase her income by about $1.5/person/month. Her average income is $8.5/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: Selling dried fish and fish sauce

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem Chheng V. is 40 years old, married, and has five children. To supplement her household income, she is self-employed as a garment worker earning around $3 each day, while her husband works as a security guard and typically makes about $3 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory, and the rest of them attend school. This couple hopes a loan will help them to purchase seeds and a plot of farmland to harvest crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a plot of farmland to harvest crops.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Hello my name is Maria Isabel, I am a retailer, my main activity is the firewood sale. This business is located in my room. This job helps me with the expenses of my family and my other commitments. I have 2 years of experience in this type of activity, with the utilities that this business generates for me I have made some improvements to my room.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Maria Isabel, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de leña, negocio que tengo ubicado en mi casa de habitación, el que me genera ingreso para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos, cuento con 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, con las utilidades que este negocio me genera he hecho algunas mejoras a mi casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase Firewood

loans.name: Sadan

texts.en:
Sadan Wanjiku I. is a 28 year old, single lady with one child.  She lives on the outskirts of Nairobi in a town called Ngong.  In the years 1997-1998, she trained as a salonist in a salon called Winique Salon, situated at River road in Nairobi.  After her training, she started working as a hair dresser in the town where she lives.  In the year 2003, she took money from her savings and opened her own salon in a place called Zambia, in the centre of the town.

Because she does not have the many types of equipment that her saloon requires, Sadan is now requesting for a loan of $775.  With this money, she will buy a dryer, a blow dryer, a pair of tongs, a flat iron, a foot massager and also some chemicals for the salon.  Wanjiku says that if she has these requirements, it will make work easier for both her and her clients.  She will be able to make more money because, right now, the demand for her services is high.  She also won’t have to go to the city to buy things because she will have enough stock.  She will also attract some more customers from her  neighboring salons, which are not providing the services that she will be able to provide.  The business will also be giving her more profits, thus giving her more money to feed and educate her child.  

The repayment Period of the loan will be 8 Months.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment including a hair drier, blow drier, tongs, flat iron, chemicals and a foot massage basin

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet N. sells retail clothing out of her home. She looks after one orphan, one widow, and one disabled person. She needs a new house because her current one floods when it rains.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a better house/store

loans.name: Dina Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Flor Maria, Dina, and Lucia have been members of the community bank “Musuq Wasi” for between one and two years. From their participation in bank activities, they have learned how to be responsible, punctual, and treat their children. They feel like their bank is a part of their family.

Flor Maria is 36 years old and has an 8 year old son. She has been selling guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy, for five years. She used to sell vegetables but their price has fallen recently.

Dina is 27 and has one child. She owns land where she raises vegetables and guinea pigs. She has owned her land for one year.

Lucia is 57 years old and has five children. Likewise, she sells vegetables and guinea pigs. She has been in this business all of her life.

Flor Maria, Dina, and Lucia need loans of 900, 600, and 300 soles ( 3 soles = $1) respectively to invest in food for their guinea pigs and seeds. The community bank emphasizes saving and each associate has an interest earning account. These three women plan to use their savings for their children’s education, medical bills, and any other emergencies that can arise. Their dream is to have successful businesses and that their children can continue moving up in the world.

loans.use: Flor Maria, Dina, and Lucia will invest in food for their guinea pigs and seeds.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao S. is a widow with four children who works as a seller of variety products, earning on average $2 a day. Two of her children work as laborers, normally earning about $1 a day. To make additional money for her family, she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice and resell for profit

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mrs. Song S., 38, lives with her husband and five children. She raises pigs at her house and also owns a plot of farmland where she grows rice, making around $1.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chai Thu, 38, works as a palm juice collector. Everyday he climbs the palm tree to tap the palm juice, refines it to sugar cane and sells it in the market, earning about five dollars a day of income.

Two children work in a factory earning $60 each per month. The others are students and help the parents work at home when they are not attending school.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a cow to plow her field. This will help to reduce the family’s expense as she has been hiring a tractor to do this work.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow fields

loans.name: Adilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Adilia, 34 years old, is married with two minor children. She teaches elementary school; she has always been a teacher and is proud of the fact that she knows she is educating tomorrow’s professionals. Her husband supports her with the household expenses, but the dream of this teacher is to have her house completely built so her family has a decent place to live with all the necessary comfort. She requests the loan to buy building material and make the necessary redesigning of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adilia es casada, tiene dos hijos menores de edad y tiene 34 años. Ella se dedica a enseñar a niños de primaria, desde siempre a sido docente y le agrada el hecho de saber que esta formando a los profesionales del mañana. Su esposo la apoya con los gastos de la casa, pero el gran anhelo de esta profesora es tener su casa construida completamente para que su familia viva en un lugar digno que cuente con todas las comodidades necesarias. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar algunas remodelaciones necesarias en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase building material to redesign dwelling.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru:
Idigul A. lives in the city of Vahdat. She's not married and has 6 children. She has a high school education. She doesn't work anywhere but supports her family working with livestock by buying small animals, raising them, and later selling them at the market. The loan she wants to obtain will be used to increase the amount of animals she can buy and increase profitability. She plans on repaying the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Аминова Идигуль жительница города Вахдат. Не замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает ,но обеспечивает свою семью , занимаясь животноводством.Покупает молодых животных , откармливает и продает на рынках. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и увеличить прибыльность ее бизнеса. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou S., age 38, has a business with her husband collecting recyclable items and reselling them to the recycling plant. They earn around $6.20 each day. This couple has four children, two of whom are students. Since they know they can take out a loan from Credit which has a low interest and long term repayment, they would like a loan to purchase a motorbike to transfer the recyclable items.

loans.use: Thou would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer recyclable items.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Ms. Bertha L. has a small general store located in the Américo Villarreal district of the city of Nuevo Laredo. Ms. Lopez was previously given a loan by Kiva. She has already finished repaying her first loan.

She is requesting a second loan in order to restock her shop with a larger selection of products that her customers are asking for. This way, she will boost profits. Ms. Lopez depends on this business to support herself as well as her son’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Bertha L. tiene un negocio de abarrotes ubicado en la colonia Américo Villarreal en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. La Sra.Bertha ya fue acreditada de Kiva ya terminó de pagar su primer préstamo.

Está solicitando su segundo préstamo para surtir más la tienda de variedad de productos que sus clientes le están solicitando y así tener más ingreso al negocio. La Sra. Bertha depende de este negocio para apoyar a sí misma y a su hijo en los estudios.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Adjakpassi

texts.fr:
Née en 1970 à Tékponou, Madame A. Adjakpassi est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Très dévouée, elle exerce le commerce de cola qu’elle vend de marché en marché. C’est un produit très recherché dans la localité. 

Outre cette activité, elle fait la restauration, c’est pourquoi elle est très reconnue et populaire dans son village. Seulement, le manque d’argent reste son principal handicap. 

Pour s’en sortir, elle sollicite un crédit pour redynamiser ses activités et améliorer son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Tékponou, Mrs. Adjakpassi A. is married and the mother of three children. Very devoted to her work and her family, she sells kola nuts from one market to the next. They are a much desired product in that area.

Besides that business, she is engaged in food service. That is why she is very well-known and popular in her village. Only the lack of capital is her principal handicap.

In order to make a go of it, she is requesting a loan to revive the businesses and improve her income from them.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling kola nuts

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es: Francisco  a sus 33 años de edad, es pintor profesional con diecinueve años de experiencia. Actualmente habita en el barrio San Judas, es casado, tienen tres hijos menores de edad, que estudian la primaria. Su esposa trabaja en ventas varias y así apoyar a Francisco con los gastos del hogar. Con el préstamo solicitado hará mejoras a su hogar,  levantará dos paredes y cambiará el techo ya que esta en muy mal estado y quiere poner zinc nuevo, para así tener una vivienda más segura para su familia, ya que su dificultad ha sido poder terminar de hacer su vivienda y lo que el anhela es poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, at 33 years old, is a professional painter with 19 years of experience. Today he lives in the San Judas neighborhood, is married, and has three children in primary school. His wife works in sales and inthis way supports Francisco wtih the household expenses. With the loan he will make improvements to his home, putting up two walls and he will change the roof as it is in poor codition and he wants to put new zinc in order to have a safer home for his family. It has been difficult for him to finish his home and what he longs for is being able to have a worthy home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two walls and change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Doña Karen habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Francisco Morazán, tiene 34 años de edad, con dos hijos de 10 y 19 años de edad, que cursan sus estudios, es madre soltera. La Sra. Karen se ha preparado con sus estudios para salir adelante con su familia aunque se le ha hecho difícil ha logrado partes de sus objetivos y espera ayudar a sus hijos para que éstos también logren sus objetivos, estudió para Fisioterapeuta, y ahora desempeña su carrera en un centro de salud estatal, y tiene trece años de experiencia. Con la solicitud del préstamo que está haciendo es para infraestructura en la construcción de un porche de la casa, para lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es poder seguir estudiando y así optar a otro cargo mejor y con mejores ingresos ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios para que sean personas con buen futuro.
texts.en:
Karen lives in a neighborhood of Managua called Francisco Morazan. She is 34 years old and a single mother of 2 children, ages 10 and 19, who are students. Karen has prepared herself with education in order to move forward with her family although it has been difficult to achieve parts of her goals. She hopes to support her children in order for them to fully achieve their goals. She studied physical therapy and has worked in a state health center for the past 13 years. With the loan that she is requesting, she would like to build a porch for her home. She needs to purchase materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron. In the long term, she would like to continue studying and apply for a better job with a higher income to support her children during their studies that will allow them to have a grand future.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Caroline S. from Mwanza. She is married with two children ages four and six years old. Additionally, she supports one dependent because she is an orphan. Caroline has been running a pharmacy business since 2005. A pharmacy in Tanzania is traditionally a small store that has many glass shelves on which a variety of medicines are displayed, from antibiotic soap to malaria medicine. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Caroline currently earns about 30 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy more medicines to sell. Caroline thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La Sr. Marlene tiene 36 años de edad, habita en La Primavera, casada su esposo es conductor de trasporte pesado, tiene tres lindo hijos de 2, 18 y 20 años de edad, dos ellos estudian en un colegio de la capital. Los planes para su familia es seguir apoyando su estudios para se preparen y tenga un mejor futuro. Doña Marlene trabaja vendiendo mercadería variadas como: cosméticos, perfumes y otros, desde hace seis años su mayor dificulta habido en la recuperación del dinero que fueron al crédito, pero gracias a Dios las persona al final pagaron y sus clientes ha aumentado un poco mas, inicio su negocio con prestamos. Sus planes para su negocio es aumentar sus productos y comprar nuevas mercaderías. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su pequeño negocio crezca y sus ingresos aumenten en beneficios de su familia y la aseguración de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marlene, 36, lives in La Primavera. Her husband is a truck driver and she has three children, 2, 18 and 20 years old, respectively. Two of her children are studying in Managua. She plans to continue supporting her children's schooling so that they can prepare themselves for a better future. Marlene makes a living selling various products: cosmetics, perfumes, etc. She's operated the business for six years. Her main problem is collecting money for products that she sells on credit. Happily, her customers pay in the end and her client base has increased little by little. Marlene started the business with loans. Her plan for the future is to add new products and increase her sales. Thanks to Afodenic loans, she's succeeded in growing her small business. She's seen the benefits to her family of an extra income and the promise it brings for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora María Esperanza F. D. S. tiene 46 años y es secretaria del Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II  y vive en el pasaje La Marina 606 del Puerto Marítimo D. Salaverry D. la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y ahora se encuentra estudiando en la escuela D. lideres que imparte Circulo Solidario. Se casó a la edad D. 18 años y actualmente tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales dependen D. ella 2 estudiantes.
María confecciona diversos tipos D. manualidades, lo realiza en su casa en un pequeño taller donD. también aprenden sus hijas la delicada profesión que tiene su madre.
Con el primer crédito D. 200 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró accesorios para las manualidades.
Con este crédito D. 2000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en insumos para ropa deportiva que también confecciona.
El gran sueño que tiene María es ver profesionales a todas sus hijas e hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esperanza F. D. S. is 46 years old and is secretary of the Entrepreneurs Community Bank II. She lives at 606 La Marina Street in the maritime port of Salaverry in the province of Trujjillo, district of La Libertad, Peru.

She completed high school and is now studying at the School of Leaders which offers the Solidarity Circle. She married at the age of 18 and now has five children of whom two are students, depending on her. Maria makes various types of crafts at home in a small workshop where her daughters also learn their mother’s delicate profession.

With her first loan of 200 soles, which she repaid in four installments, she bought accessories for making handicrafts. With this loan of 2000 soles, which will be repaid in six installments, she will invest in materials for sportswear which she also makes.

Maria’s great dream is to see all her daughters and sons become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in materials for making sportswear.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
La elaboración de calzados es un negocio que requiere de mucha entrega y gran dedicación ya que se debe tener vasta experiencia para elaborar los calzados de todo tipo, estilos, tamaños y para ambos sexos.

En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor José Galan se dedica a su negocio de elaboración de calzados los que son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación y también son enviados a diferentes lugares para ser vendidos. Es importante destacar que él ha sobresalido como un excelente comerciante y esto gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos. Hoy en día espera que su solicitud le sea aprobada para obtener el dinero para la compra de materia prima y continuar en la elaboración de los calzados.
texts.en:
Shoemaking is a trade that requires much hard work and dedication because one needs to have a vast amount of experience to make shoes in all types, styles, sizes and for both genders.

In the city of Masaya, Mr. José Galan makes shoes for living. He sells some from home while others are sent to different places to be sold. It is important to note that he has excelled as an entrepreneur thanks to support from Ceprodel via loans. He now hopes that his loan request will be approved so that the can purchase raw materials and continue making shoes.
