Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy E. is a hair stylist. She makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells drinks, both wholesale and retail, to her customers.

She now needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more drinks to sell.

She is 34 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Guadalupe G. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada que posee su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos los cuales comercializa ella misma todos los días con el propósito de mantener su hogar.

Es importante destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera y para esto se esfuerza a diario. La razón por la cual ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos y  así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Living in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Señora Guadalupe G. runs a business making and selling meals. She works very hard, every day, in order to maintain her home. It is important to emphasize that she is known as an excellent cook, and she continues each day to work hard at making the best food possible. She has asked for this loan so that she can buy the ingredients of her meals and in this way, continue running her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. She is 46 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children: two daughters, who are 22 and 12, and a son who is 14. Maria Elena runs a bar/restaurant in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. She has had the restaurant for many years, and serves a variety of meals: soups, breakfasts, and a daily set lunch for 3 soles (US$1). Most of the food she serves is traditional local food, like rice with eggs. She usually works alone, though sometimes her children help her.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy ingredients to prepare meals (like rice, eggs, oil and meat). Her goal for the future is to have a large restaurant of her own. She smiles and her eyes sparkle when she talks about the restaurant of her dreams.

loans.use: Buy rice, eggs, oil and meat

loans.name: Meera

texts.en:
Meera P. is a resident of Khokhana-Dobata. Khokhana-Dobato is located in Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Meera P. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her older son is studying in grade 7 and her younger son is studying in grade 2.

Both Mrs. and Mr. P. are engaged in the traditional work of tailoring, which they learned from their forefathers. They make different types of clothes, including ladies clothing and dresses. They make pants and shirts for gentlemen and kurta sulwar, blouses and makhshi for ladies.

Now Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Wadih

texts.en: Wadih is a 22 year-old single parent supporting two children and living in Dekwaneh, Mount Lebanon. He has been working as an auditor for the past three years. Today he wants to borrow $1,200 to improve his productivity by buying a laptop computer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 36 years old and married to Renato C., who is 42 years old. Renato is a local farmer in their agriculture-based community village, Barangay Minallo Naguillan, Isabela . They are blessed with three children: the eldest, Rhea Joyce, is 14 years old and a high school student; Rosalie is 10 years old and is studying in the primary level, while Ryan is 4 years old.

In addition to farming, her family also earns a living selling vegetables. Susana manages the vegetable sales daily in order to supply her family with their immediate necessities. She is about to renew her loan with ASKI and is requesting PHP 6,000 as additional working capital for her business. Susana happily shares with us that her sales really are a big help paying for the studies of her children. She hopes that her business will grow and last for a very long time. With the new loan, she hopes to improve their whole house and assist her children as they pursue their education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: N'djokoun

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, cette femme habite avec sa famille le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle fait comme commerce la vente de céréales. Pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur son commerce elle  s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays à sotoboua où le bol de maïs est moins coûteux. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter , 18 sacs de maïs, 7 sacs d’haricots et divers autres céréales.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in Kégué, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé. Her business consists in selling cereals. In order to get the highest possible gross margin, she gets her supplies in the interior of the country, in Sotoboua, where corn is cheaper. She wants to resupply, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 18 sacks of corn, 7 sacks of bean, and various other cereals.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 18 sacks of corn, 7 sacks of bean, and various other cereals

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en:
Leaso Kerisimasi, 25, is married with 2 children. She has four years of experience in the brick business. She sells to the public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~ USD).

SPBD loans are Leaso’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks to maintain and improve her business. She is a multi-talented young mother; she started her business with a plantation and now she is selling bricks in order for her businesses to become successful.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, dust

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy Omorogbe sells drinks at wholesale and retail. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Dorothy is requesting the loan amount of 120,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mose

texts.fr: Mose N. est depuis 2005 dans le monde de micro-entreprise. Son activité initiale consistait à vendre des bidons d’huile de palme et du pétrole. Le temps et l’environnement l’ont amenée à ouvrir une boutique qu’elle gère jusqu’à ce jour. Pour réaliser son rêve Mose a décidé de se faire cliente de l’IMF Hope RDC. Elle a reçu 7 fois les prêts de cette Institution qu’elle a remboursés correctement. Le prochain crédit lui servira d’acheter des articles tels que des boites de conserve, tomates, sardines, cartes prépayées, etc. … pour renforcer le stock de la marchandise de sa boutique. Son affaire se situe sur une montagne à l’est de la ville de Kinshasa. Mose a 53 ans, veuve et mère de 3 filles et 7 garçons âgés entre 12 et 35 ans. Huit de ces enfants vont à l’école et deux sont indépendants. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un jour un dépôt de ciment et de farine de froment.
texts.en:
Since 2005, Mose N. has been in the world of micro-enterprises. Her initial business involved selling drums of palm oil and kerosene. The times and the environment have lead her to open a shop, which she still manages today. To realize her dream, Moses decided to become a client of the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC. She has received seven loans from this Institution, and she repaid them correctly. The next loan will be used to buy goods, such as canned food, tomatoes, sardines, prepaid cards, etc….for bolstering the stock of merchandise in her shop. Her business is located on a mountain, east of the city of Kinshasa. Mose is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of three girls and seven boys, ages 12 to 35. Eight of these children go to school, and two are independent. Her ambition is to open an outlet for cement and for wheat flour.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos, quienes requieren de sus cuidados por ser menores de edad. Es por ello que junto a su pareja tratan de brindarles las comodidades necesarias dentro y fuera de casa. Desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio y desde hace un año vende balones de gas, negocio en el cual se inició gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien habilitó un espacio en su casa para ello. Isabel atiende a sus clientes con mucho agrado, brindando el servicio de instalación a domicilio, pero trabajar sola la limita, por ello trata de apoyarse en sus hermanos e hijos quienes la ayudan con su negocio. Sin embargo, para incrementar sus ventas requiere de la ambientación de su local para así exhibir su mercadería y también quiere contar con diversas marcas de gas reconocidas en el mercado, para ello espera negociar con las diversas empresas para sus provisiones. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es la responsabilidad y compromiso de todas las integrantes. Los 2000 que ahora solicita le permitirán diversificar las marcas de gas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Ysabel is married and the mother of two young children who require her supervision. For this reason, both she and her husband try to provide them the necessary comforts both inside and away from home. Ysabel has always worked from a young age and started selling tanks of gas one year ago. She started this business with the help of her husband, who set aside space in their home so that she could manage it. Ysabel tends to her customers with great pleasure by providing home installation services. Working alone has its limits, so she relies on the assistance of her siblings and her children to help run the business. However, in order to increase her sales, she needs an appropriate business location where she can exhibit her merchandise. She would also like to sell different well-known brands of gas, but she needs to negotiate with different suppliers so that she can acquire their products.

This is Ysabel’s 13th loan with MFP. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the responsibility and commitment of all the members. She will use her loan of 2000 soles to diversify her inventory so that she can offer different brands of gas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her inventory

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma L. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Alma owns and operates a business raising crops, mainly planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,404 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus A. is from the village of Brgy. 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 59 years old. Jesus is married and has two grown children. To make a living, Jesus owns and operates a furniture-making business.  He makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Jesus has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making additional furniture

loans.name: Agua De La Vida Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  AGUA DE LA VIDA, está conformado por doce señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Zona San Luis, una de las zonas humildes de la ciudad; la característica principal de sus casas, es que son de adobe en gran parte de ellas son inquilinas o en anticrético. La directiva está conformada por la Sra. Celestina, Sra. Maxima y la Sra. Simona. Las socias de este grupo se desempeñan en un mercado altamente competitivo en los rubros de confección de mantas y ropa, venta de ropa, venta de comida y condimentos, venta de mantas y venta de carne. Pero debido a su grado de experiencia en los diferentes rubros saben cómo salir adelante. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima tales como telas, hilos y lanas; ellas están muy animadas por trabajar con Agrocapital y de forma verbal ellas solicitaron el crédito. Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo, la mayoría de ellas se conocen entre sí, es un grupo de personas muy alegres. Se hace notar que en la foto se encuentran dos varones que son los esposos de Delmira y Simona quienes no pudieron ir a la primera reunión, ellos salen en la foto en representación de ellas.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: K. Eugénie est née le 07 Février 1968 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à MIDODJIHO Félix, un dessinateur, Eugénie est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 10 ans à Hinkoudé, un quartier de Porto-Novo. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Eugénie et Félix. Eugénie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis 10 ans déjà, elle s’est livrée à la vente de nourriture (sauce de mouton accompagnée de l’akassa, aliment fait à base d’amidon de maïs, et du poisson). Eugénie fait ses approvisionnements au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo, et vend sa nourriture à Koutongbé, un quartier de Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Eugénie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
K. Eugénie was born on February 7, 1968 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Married to MIDODJIHO Félix, a draftsman, Eugénie is the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. For 10 years, the family has been living in Hinkoudé, a district of Porto-Novo. Family living expenses are a shared responsibility of Eugénie and Félix.

Eugénie never went to school. For 10 years, she has been selling cooked food (mutton stew with 'akassa', a dish made of cornstarch, and fish). Eugénie buys her ingredients in the market Ouando in Porto-Novo, and sells her food in Koutongbé, a district of Porto-Novo. She has been a client of ALIDé for some time and has had two loans which have been correctly reimbursed. Eugénie is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to add to her working capital and grow her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mutton and condiments such as tomatos, onions, hot peppers, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a forty-one year old married woman with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Rose works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. Rose is in the palm oil business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities and villages, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community and buyers from cities. She also sells at the local market and treks as well. Rose has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 30 years old and is married. He has eighteen years of experience in this business and established his cafeteria twelve years ago. The cafeteria is in a good location in the city and hundreds of young people visit it to spend their time. Thus he gains a good income.

The purpose behind this loan is to expand his cafeteria in order to accomodate more customers and bring in a waiter as well.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and to improve the restaurant decor

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: El grupo San Miguel es muy compacto la mayoría son nuevas vecinas de la zona y con mucho entusiasmo de trabajar y por la oportunidad que tienen en este ciclo siendo la base de este las socias antiguas que no pasan de cinco fruto del reciclaje. Unas venden productos de perfumería (yanbal, esika, avon, etc.), una de ellas lava ropa, venden refrescos y/ o comida (almuerzo o cena). La competencia  esta fuerte ya que la  situación económica esta difícil y hay que tomar en cuenta cada día que pasa más gente se suma al comercio informal pero hay que resaltar el esfuerzo y el compromiso de las socias antiguas para cumplir con sus cuotas. El crédito será invertido en vA. formas por ejemplo las socias que venden cosméticos para hacer sus pedidos personales y tener mercadería para poder vender de forma individual, una en especial que vende comida para comprar mesas y sillas de plástico para su pensión, y la gran mayoría lo invertirá en su respectivo negocio u oficio para generarse más ingresos, es decir como capital de operaciones. Más que todo las socias que están desde el primer ciclo tienen experiencia en trabajar con instituciones financieras similares, de otras en cambio será la primera vez que trabajan con crédito comunal. Respecto a las socias antiguas continúan en el presente ciclo por demostrar cumplimiento al plan de pagos que se les otorga y sobre todo el acato a nuestras normas.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Group is very close-knit. Most of its members are new, and live in the same neighborhood. They are very enthusiastic to work hard and take advantage of the opportunity offered to them in this loan cycle. There are about 5 returning group members who are taking out new loans. Some group members sell cosmetic products (Yanbal, Esika and Avon brands), one is a laundress, and others sell drinks and/or food (lunch or dinner). There is a lot of competition in these fields, since every day more and more people are taking up informal commerce, but each group member makes a notable effort to pay off each loan installment on time. The group members will invest their loans in a variety of different things: those who sell cosmetics will use the money to fill their personal orders; one client will buy plastic tables and chairs for her small restaurant, and most of the remaining clients will invest the money in their respective businesses and jobs in order increase revenue. The returning group members have previous experience at other similar financial institutions, while others are taking out a group loan for the first time. Returning clients have been invited back due to their demonstrated commitment to paying off their loan installments on time and complying with Fundación Agrocapital's standards.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es:
José tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres y un hermano en el caserío Punto Nueve, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores (chanchos, ovejas, patos y gallinas), empezó a trabajar en esta actividad desde hace 10 años ayudando a su padre. Luego tuvo la oportunidad de criar sus propios animales y desde entonces esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de sustento. Además se desempeña como peón agrícola en los terrenos agrícolas de la zona. Con estas actividades solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia.

José se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales para su engorde y posterior venta.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo. El es un joven trabajador y responsable; sus vecinos y familiares lo estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Jose is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents and a brother in the small village of Punto Nueve in the Mochumí district, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He works raising and marketing small animals (pigs, sheep, ducks and chickens.) He started in this line of work 10 years ago helping his father. Later he had the opportunity to raise his own animals, and since then this activity has gradually become his principal source of sustenance. In addition, he is a farm worker in the agricultural lands in the area. With these activities he covers his personal expenses and helps to sustain his family. Jose is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Peruvian soles that he will use to purchase more animals to fatten and later sell. His biggest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur, and to acquire his own land to cultivate. He is a hardworking and responsible young person; his neighbors and relatives hold him in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk for resale

loans.name: Armik

texts.en:
Armik A. was born in 1954 in Manashid village, Azerbaijan. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Now, Armik lives in Aghavnadzor village in the Ijevan area with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. His daughter is married and lives with her husband in Vardenis city.

Before, Armik worked as a brigadier for about four years, deputy village head for about three years, and eight years as a milkman. Since 2000, he and his son have been engaged in farming (stock-breeding, bee-keeping and market gardening) on their private land in Aghavnavanq village. With profit from farming, Armik has provided all of his family’s needs.

Armik needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and to repair the roof of his cattle-shed.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and to repair the roof of his cattle-shed

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto A. is 28 years old and married to Ramona Fernandez, who is also 28 years old. They have two marvelous children.

Roberto began this type of work in 1997 as an employee in a rubber company. After a number of years he had gained enough experience that he decided to start his own business. He now has a solid client base throughout the city.

Robert will use the loan to purchase more used tents to repair and later sell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more used tents to repair and sell

loans.name: Ma. Rona

texts.en:
Ma. Rona A. is from the village of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Ma. Rona is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Ma. Rona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Rona has been engaged in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Rona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Rona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Rona is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Rona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim A. is 52 years old and lives in Preaek Ta Ong Ti Pir village in Kandal province. He is a mechanic who is able to earn a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Yeoun Mean (shown on the right in the photo), is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows crops to earn income.

For his wife’s farming, Mr. Chim A. does not have enough money to support it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline and sesame seed, to pay for plowing, and to pay for renting the sesame field.

This couple has three children, one of whom stays at home and also supports the mother farming, another one is a soldier while the last one is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To support his wife's farming

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en:
Joy V. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 46 years old. Joy is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Joy V.'s Group.

Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Trust We Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Trust We”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the second loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. The previous loan created significant impact in the lives and businesses of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid that loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan of SLL 2,600,000 for the entire group in order to further improve their businesses.   

Their leader, 32-year-old Mamusu B. (pictured left), sells fried foods such as fried meat, fish, chicken and eggs with bread and stew. She will invest her share of the loan in her fried food business by buying ingredients like mayonnaise, tomato ketchup, oil, eggs, onions, pepper, etc. at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, tomato ketchup, oil, eggs, onions, pepper, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Deji

texts.en: Deji O. is a hard working and friendly man. He loves his business because of the opportunity to interact with his customers. He sells mattresses at retail prices to his customers. He is 32 years old, single without children. He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more mattresses to sell.  He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more mattresses to sell

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima O. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 57 years old, married and has 9 adult-aged children. Maxima owns and operates a poultry business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and fowl in the local community. Maxima has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it.

Maxima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maxima is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital in her business. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Maxima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rent a new shop for her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama S. est une femme mariée  âgée  de 33 ans qui habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est mère  de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 10 ans. Elle est societaire de l’institution de l’U-IMCEC  depuis avril 2010. Elle a une expérience  de 10 ans dans le commerce de légumes. Son intention étant  de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales c’est la raison pour laquelle elle a choisi cette activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de légumes  pour ainsi renforcer son activité de commerce. Elle souhaite diversifier les variétés  de légumes  qu’elle commercialise avec les carottes, les oignons, les persils et les piments. Son crédit  peut l’aider selon elle à acquérir  une certaine stabilité financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama S. is 33 years old, married, and lives in Bambilor. She is the mother of 3 children ranging in age from 4 to 10 years old. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit union since April 2010. With 10 years of experience in selling vegetables, she chose this activity in order to support her husband in their household expenses. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to be used for buying vegetables, to increase her sales activity. She wants to increase the range of the vegetables that she sells with carrots, onions, parsley and peppers. According to Mrs. S., her loan will help her to acheive a certain level of financial stability.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase funds

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela J. is a widow  who lives in Sitio Mapait, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  fishing and a general store.

Tarcela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tarcela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a profit of PHP 18,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear and new multi-cab (a mini-truck) to use for her deliveries. She can then continue to save up for future house renovations.  J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)  is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and a mini-truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, and gasoline.

loans.name: Garciano

texts.en:
Garciano V. is from the village of Cabisera 5. He is 42 years old. Garciano is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Garciano owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Garciano has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Garciano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Garciano is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Garciano from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros P., 51, is married with two children living at home in Takeo province. She is a teacher at a state school, typically making US$ 2.50 each day, and her husband works in construction, making US$ 4 a day. Ros P. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Edelmira Felix

texts.es: Edelmira Félix tiene 51 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdos y molino. Hace más 15 años tiene de dedicarse a este negocio, ella tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora ya que desde joven ha logrado aprender este medio de vida que es muy necesario para mantener a su familia. Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de cerdos ya que les gusta comprarlos bien gorditos. Sueña con tener un camión para transportar a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Edelmira Félix is 51 years old. She buys and sells pigs, and she has a grinder. She has had this business for over 15 years. She has two children who work in an independent manner. Therefore, she is always looking for a way to improve her income. She has always been a hard-working woman. Ever since she was young she managed to learn this way of life, which is very necessary to the support of her family. The loan she is requesting is to buy pigs; she likes to buy them pretty fat. She dreams of having a truck to transport the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old. She is married with 6 children who are now between the ages of 17 and 30. Four of the children are currently attending school. She is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 30 years and has employed three people from her community. Her main products are milk and maize which she sells to the local market.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000KES to purchase and feed a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her in paying school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to acquire four more dairy cows and a dairy unit. Her primary challenge is lack of enough water especially during the dry season.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rain Rose

texts.en:
Rain Rose D. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old. Rain Rose is single. To make a living, Rain Rose operates a transportation services business. Rain Rose is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rain Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Rain Rose from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Be Honest Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the two members of the “Be Honest” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to help them improve their businesses.

The leader of this group is Fatmata J..  Fatmata is age forty; she was born in Waterloo, where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a teacher and two of her children are attending primary school and two are in secondary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for twenty years now; she sells market food items – groundnuts, rice, palm oil, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice, palm oil, sugar, etc. in larger quantity

loans.name: Mujeres Comalapenses Group

texts.es:
MUJERES COMALAPENSES

MARIA TERESA M. S..
 
 ella tiene 58 años de edad,ES LA LIDER DEL GRUPO  tiene un hijo que le ayuda mensualmente en sus gastos, ella se dedica ala venta de productos de comestibles y tambien  a la venta de helados hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad, pertenece a un grupo de Bcos. Pero ahora por la epoca de fin de año necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderíae comestibles  para surtir mejor su negocio.

GLENDA AMARILIS L. M.
tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo es madre soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración de guipiles a mano y tambien fajas tejidas a mano necesita su credito para poder comprar materia prima para poder elaborar mas producto porque en esta epoca hay demanda de su producto.

CRISTOBALINA S. C..

tiene 35 años de edad, es Perito Contador, pero por falta de empleo no ha podido trabajar en su profesion, ella tiene 2 niños pequenos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de delantales bordados a maquina, desde hace 3 años que se dedica a esa actividad, ella necesita su credito para  obtener materia prima para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
MUJERES COMALAPENSES

MARIA TERESA M. S..
Maria Teresa, 58, is the group's leader.  She has a S. who helps her with monthly expenses.  Maria Teresa has operated a business selling everyday commodities, along with ice cream, for several years.  She belongs to a lending group and needs a loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery business.

GLENDA AMARILIS L. M.
Glenda, 23, is the single mother of one child.  She operates a business making and selling "guipiles" and "fajas" (traditional items of clothing for women).  Demand for Glenda's products increases this time of year and she is applying for a loan to buy the materials she needs to make them.

CRISTOBALINA S. C..
Cristobalina, 35, is a trained bookkeeper but, because there's no work, she can't work in the profession.  She has 2 young children.  She has operated a business making and selling machine-stitched smocks for 3 years.  She is applying for a loan to buy materials for the business and, ultimately, to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Manzooran Muhammad Saleem's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran M. S. is married and has given birth to two sons and two daughters (in the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Manzooran). All of her children are studying except the youngest who is just three years old. Manzooran is a talented lady who operates an embroidery and clothes sewing business from her home to supplement her family’s income. Most of her clients are from neighboring areas, and she receives a good number of orders every month.

Manzooran’s husband operates a CD center in the market from which he sells different DVDs and CDs of movies and songs. He deals with a good number of customers every day. Some of the customers buy CDs and DVDs while others rent them.

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah. She is a new Asasah client, and this is her first loan application. She is requesting a loan for the expansion of her husband’s business. He will use the money to purchase the latest CDs and DVDs to sell to his customers. He started this business six years ago, and Manzooran hopes that a loan will improve his business further.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs for her husband's shop

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus has been in the farming business for the last nine years. He has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya which produces eggs, milk and tomatoes. He sells all his products to the local market. He also earns income from his butchery business in the same location. His biggest challenge has been poultry diseases.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000KES and has requested this loan of 60,000KES to expand his poultry project. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. In the next 5 years, he wishes to have 1000 chickens and supply eggs to the local market.  

Justus is 49 years old. He is married with 7 children who are between the ages of 2 and 22.

loans.use: To expand his poultry business.

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume T., age 30, offers motorela or habal-habal transportation services to local community members. Naume has been engaged in her business along with her husband for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. She and her husband live in the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, and have two school-aged children. 

Earlier this year, Naume joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Naume is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand transportation services provided

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, de  50 años, vive con su esposo  Felipe y  tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con los dos menores. En armonía  habitan  su casa que es  propia, y esta ubicada en una comunidad en la selva central peruana.Su sonrisa muestra la apacible vida de Susana, ya que junto a Felipe, su eterno compañero comparte el cuidado de sus sembríos, desde hace 26 años. Sus siembras de café y plátanos, son las mejores frutas  de su zona, pues su secreto según dice es  “cuidarlos con mucho amor y dedicación”. En todo este tiempo logró obtener 6 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, pues gracias a su buen juicio en las ventas, puede comercializar su café a buen precio; de la misma manera su cosecha de plátano de la variedad seda, le otorga buenos dividendos, pues esa variedad escasea. Entre los  planes de Susana, se encuentran alquilar más terrenos agrícolas para incursionar en la siembra de otros  productos como maíz y yuca.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde es muy solidaria y responsable.Susana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá en su próximo cultivo, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Susana, 50, lives with her husband Felipe with whom she has 9 children, although only the two youngest ones live with them. They all live in harmony in their own house, located in a community in the central rainforest area in Peru. Susana's smile reflects her peaceful life. She has been tending the crops alongside Felipe, her eternal companion, for 26 years. Their banana and coffee crops bear the best fruits in the area, and she says that the secret is "to look after them with love and dedication". In all this time she has managed to extend her farms to 6 hectares of land thanks to her good sense in selling and being able to sell her coffee at a good price. Her banana crops also provide them with good dividends because they are of the scarce "silk" variety.

Susana's plans include leasing more farming land to venture into new products such as corn and yuca. She is a member of the communal bank "Las Palmas" ("The Palm Groves") and this is her third loan with MFP. She is very supportive and responsable. Susana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of several bags of fertiliser, which she will use for her next crop, to help her continue to progress.

loans.use: Buy fertiliser to improve her crops.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced with a grown daughter, Victoria. She lives in Melitopol. Ludmila runs a clothing venture selling women’s outer wear items in the central marketplace. She owns a well-equipped vending kiosk which is convenient for potential customers who stop by to try something on and buy from her.  

Ludmila started her business 12 years ago. It has grown up to a size of 45,000 Grivnyas in inventory and 17,000 Grivnyas in gross income. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. Ludmila is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clothing items at a wholesale price and re-sell them at retail, thus generating additional profit as a result. She is hoping to continue growing her trade and to assist her daughter financially whenever she can.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui, 37, is married and lives with his wife and one year old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife works as a bus conductor for a transportation company where she is paid 380,000 MNT per month. 

Nergui started a meat and coal trading business in 2009. He brings coal from a mine which is located near Ulaanbaatar and sells it at a local market. He also operates a stall where he sells meat. His average daily sales volume is about 250,000 MNT, and his monthly profit is between 400,000-500,000 MNT. He was able to build a new house with the profits he made from his business.  Nergui is a hardworking and honest person who says, " I would like to buy a jeep in the future". He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase two tons of meat as prices are expected to rise in the coming season.

loans.use: To purchase two tons of meat

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida O. is from the village of Maguikay, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old. Loida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Loida owns & operates a furniture-making business.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Loida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Loida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Loida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Loida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel Antonio H. A. de 52 años, vive junto a su esposa y un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, quien depende por completo de Miguel y junto a quienes reside en Apopa. Él es un señor muy responsable, quien trabaja como albañil, oficio que realiza desde hace 30 años atrás, lo que lo hace todo un experto en reparar diferentes objetos. Miguel desea mucho salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar todas las herramientas necesarias como: tornillos, soldadores, llaves y otros más los cuales le permitan hacer más eficiente su trabajo. De esta manera Miguel espera salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio H. A., age 52, lives with his wife and his little four year old son.  His son is completely dependent upon Miguel.  They live together in Apopa.  

He is a very responsible man who works as a builder.  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  That makes him a complete expert at repairing different things.  Miguel very much wishes to get ahead and offer his family everything they need.

That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  With the loan he will be able to buy the tools he needs like screws, soldering-irons, wrenches, and more.  They will allow him to do his work more efficiently.  That way Miguel hopes to get ahead and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy tools to do his work

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou P. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. sells cow ties, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband raises chickens and ducks, earning an income of $1.60 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 on food and $100 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase more cow ties and clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be P.'s second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase ties and clothes to sell

loans.name: Memsu Group

texts.en:
Isatu J. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Makeni city, about 38 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has one child who is attending secondary school. Isatu sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloth) and has been in this business for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan, 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL),  to buy gara lapper making materials--ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc.--in order to produce a larger quantity of cloth for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dyed cloth

loans.name: Mujurizi

texts.en: Mujurizi E. is an individual client from Bushenyi. He is 26 years old and single. He is into the business of selling produce like beans, millet, cotton, groundnuts and maize. hH operates from his home in Nyamirima, selling mostly to other bigger traders from neighboring districts and town dwellers, and he is able to make 420,000/= as monthly profits. He has been in the business for over 4 years, after working for someone else, until he started his own business. His dream is to be able to grow his business and get married. He also grows cotton and coffee on plantations. He is a very hard-working young man, and he needs a loan to be able to buy more produce and cereals for resale.

loans.use: to buy more produce and cereals for resale

loans.name: C4707 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Elisa is 22 years old and is single. He is the representative of a group called "Intwari" in the local language. Elisa is the first person on the left, with his hand raised. 

Elisa has a beauty salon in Kigali which attracts many working-class clients. He has been in this business for one year.  His beauty salon is well organized; he is open from 8am until 7pm every day and employs three people to help him. One of the challenges in his business is not having enough equipment in the hair salon, especially for women clients.

Elisa and his group have requested a loan from a Kiva lender in order to purchase new equipment for Elisa's beauty salon. With this profit, Elisa will reinvest in his business and save for his family.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his salon

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
Hortensia nació en la comunidad de Arin departamento (Cusco, Perú), tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus tres hijos, quien son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. 

Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive, han sido en la vida de Hortensia un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras vegetales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Cusco. Hortensia solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará gallinas blancas y semillas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Hortensia was born in Arin community, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 41 years old and is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner and three children who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

The green fields of Arin community (which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas and is where Hortensia currently lives), have been a very pleasant place for Hortensia to work over the years.  Her parents taught her to farm when she was very young and now she owns her own land on which she works together with her partner.  With a lot of care, they sow vegetables such as potatoes and corn.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since then she feels that all her hard work is paying off.  Hortensia has been in this business for years and she considers the most difficult part of her business to be transporting her crops to the warehouses which are located in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco.

Hortensia is requesting this loan to carry out one of her plans which is to expand her business raising animals such as hens and guinea pigs.  She must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do so as she would like to access future loans.  She is grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy white hens and seeds to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy white hens and seeds so that she can increase her production

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 48 años de edad,  ella tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad, actualmente no cuenta con carga familiar directa, blanca con casa propia la cual está ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de Chiclayo.

Blanca Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma, hace 3 años. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, haci como también bebidas, el negación tiene buena cogida y en este tiempo a conseguido tener clientela fija.

Blanca está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para que pueda acondicionar un espacio de sus casa solo para la venta de cerveza, cuales tienen muy buen nivel de ventas los fines de semanas.

Blanca es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 48, has two grown children.  She does not currently have any dependent relatives.  Blanca has her own house, which is located in a rural area in the Chiclayo district.  

Blanca has a small general store set up in her house.  She has been taking care of it herself for three years.  She sells to her neighbors and customers in the area.  She sells diverse daily consumption products, basic needs products, and groceries.  She also sells drinks.  The business is well received, and she has managed to get regular customers.

Blanca is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to set up a space in her house solely for the sale of beer.  There is a good level of beer sales on the week-ends.

Blanca is a very hard-working woman and is of good moral character.  The people who know her hold her in high esteem and are fond of her.

loans.use: to fix up a space in her business in order to sell beer.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 48 years old, does braiding with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. They have three children, and they are 22, 21, and 19 years old. All of them are working in the factory and get $5 for each day.  

Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on rent and $50 on transportation and other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to get to work. 

In the future, she wants to have a good house, because now her house is not in good condition and needs a lot of repair.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children get to work.

loans.name: Kassofor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03juin 2010. Ledit groupe est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Fatou Bintou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson et de sucre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et d'accroitre  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises eleven women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. Ms. Fatou Bintou (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also supports three other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

Fatou is active in selling fish and sugar. She has good experience in this domain of work, which she has been doing for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to increase her business. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fish and sugar

loans.name: Benyamin

texts.en:
Benyamin is a 42 year-old man, married to Diana, a 37 year-old lady. Their marriage has been blessed with four adorable children, namely Yeti, a sixteen year-old girl who is in the second year of senior high school; Fernando, a 14 year-old boy in the second year of junior high school; Samaria, an 11 year-old girl in the fourth grade of elementary school; and Frits, a 7 year-old boy in the second grade of elementary school.

Benyamin has been running a room rental business for seven years in order to fulfill the basic needs of his family.  His wife is working as a seamstress to assist him in generating money for their living. By setting up his unused rooms, he has attracted the students who come from countryside and want to continue study in the city, but don't have any relatives or place to stay.  They can rent a small room with access to clean water and electricity and pay IDR 75,000 on a monthly basis. 

Benyamin is dreaming of renovating his rental house but needs money to do so. He met TLM’s loan officer who promoted TLM’s lending program to the community in his village. Benyamin got interested in joining the program. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. Benyamin is hoping that he gets the loan to purchase zinc, cement and other materials to renovate his rental house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate the rooms to be leased

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, a 50-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling fish such as sardines and mackerel for the last five years. A new member of HSPFI, Alicia has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 51 years old and is married with three children aged between 15 and 21 years old. She sells animals such as chickens and goats. Her business is well-organized. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 7 pm every day. She has five years experience in this business and she employs one person to help her. Alice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more animals to raise and sell. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and goats for sale

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past year, Bibi has operated a business making tea for sale, selling at the school site to school teachers and school children. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two goats, tea leaves, and sugar for making tea for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two goats, tea leaves, and sugar for making tea for sale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is from the village of Vardisubani in the Kakheti region of East Georgia. He is 56 years old and lives with his wife, Nani. 

Nani works as a teacher in the local school. Albert is a joiner. He has his own workshop, where he produces home furniture, mainly beds. He sells his products in Tbilisi, in a trade center. His total average monthly income is 1,100 GEL. 

Albert requested credit for purchasing wood as a raw material for his workshop. He will make beds and sell them in Tbilisi in the fall. In the fall, the demand for home furniture, as well as prices, will increase in comparison to the summer months. By that time, Albert will have products ready to supply the market. 

In the future, Albert plans to save some of his income for house renovation, in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his workshop.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Садулло целеустремленный и честный человек. Он занимается перевозкой пассажиров на местном города. Он относятся со своими клиентами добро и мягко. Он начинал данный бизнес 7 лет назад с арендованным автомобилям. Постепенно зарабатывая денег, он купил себе автомобиль марки «Газель-2705». Садулло хотел бы получить займ для установки газового оборудования и покупка автошин в зимний период.
texts.en: Sadullo is a purposeful and honest man. He transports passengers around local towns. He treats his customers kindly and gently. He started his business seven years ago with a rented vehicle. Step by step by earning money he bought himself a car of brand Gazel-2705. Sadullo wants to get a loan to install gas equipment and to buy tires for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy tires for the car and to install gas equipment

loans.name: Mehrob

texts.ru: Мехроб занимается купля продажей продукты питания. Он имеет магазин, в котором продает широкий ассортимент продукты питания. Он начинал данный бизнес с 5000 Сомони а постепенно увеличивал свой оборотный капитал. Его торговая точка находится в жилом районе города и вблизи от его магазина находиться профилакторий, что благоприятно влияет на его торговлю. От данного бизнеса он получает стабильный доход, и он очень хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить ассортимента продукта. С этой целью Мехроб запрашивает займ в размере 12000 Сомони.
texts.en: Mehrob is involved in buying and selling food products.  He has a store, where he sells a wide assortment of food products.  He started his business with 5000 Somoni and gradually increased his revolving capital.  Mehrob's store is located in a residential neighborhood of the town, and there is a treatment facility near his store, which positively affects his sales.  He earns a stable income from this business, wants to expand his business and expand an assortment of products.  This is why Mehrob is requesting a loan in the sum of 12000 Somoni.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of food products

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en: Marlina is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children and has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Marlina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Fifa Christon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFA CHRISTON est formé de vingt cinq personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Amelin Alphonsine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Amelin Alphonsine est âgée de 55 ans, et est mariée à un douanier du nom de Valère. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Amelin Alphonsine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Amelin Alphonsine  vend des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Amelin Alphonsine achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. C’est la deuxième fois que Amelin Alphonsine et les autres membres du groupement FIFA CHRISTON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group FIFA CHRISTON is made up of 25 persons who all live in the same district in Bénin. The representative of this group, Amelin Alphonsine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Amelin Alphonsine is 55 and married to a customs agent named Valère. The couple have four children, all living under their roof. 

Amelin Alphonsine did not go to school. For about 20 years, she has been selling kitchen utensils through the distribution system, allowing her to help her husband support their family. Amelin Alphonsine buys her products in Bénin and in Togo. It's the second time that she and the other members of the group called FIFA CHRISTON are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will permit them to expand their businesses so as to be better able to respond to the needs of their clientele. The first loan was correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 44-year-old man. He is married and has one son and three daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Sami wants to purchase new home furniture to improve his family's living conditions. He wants to buy bedroom furniture for the children, dining room furniture, living room seats, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Sami gets the loan, he will be able to change his family's life positively by purchasing new home furniture. Sami is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Clavelitos De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELITOS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julieta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, costura de edredones, venta de comida, venta de pescado.

La señora Julieta,  indica que es la primera ves trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de edredones que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá del de la 16 de Julio, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en los puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CLAVELITOS DE VILLA INGENIO" will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional hub Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is guided by a board of directors headed by Julieta. The businesses that the members of the communal bank are involved in vary, and among them we have: knitting sweaters, a neighborhood store, sewing quilts, selling food, and selling fish.

Julieta says this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the organization at the invitation of her friends. She currently has a business sewing quilts, which she has been working at for years, having learned it from friends.

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (to buy fabric) which she will acquire at the July 16th marketplace, wholesale, and afterwards she will sell it in stalls. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the loan education.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 33 years old, married and has one child. She lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Mae has been selling clothing for the past five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Mae has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mae hopes to save for the education of her son.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothes for her business.

loans.name: Serapia Rosalia

texts.es: Serapia,es viuda tiene 55 años de edad tiene 6 hijos pero con ella solo tiene a la hija de 16 años de edad ya que los demas son casados ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y venta de ponchos, ropa, zapatos ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años cuando sus hijos iban a la escuela ya que sus esposo se dedicaba a trabajar en el campo y lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba para sostener a su familia,con el paso del tiempo ella ha incrementado sus ventas ella esta solicitando este credito para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir mas su tienda,espera que kiva le pueda ayudar.
texts.en: Serapia is a 55 year old widow, has six children but only her 16 year old daughter lives with her as her other children are married, she sells groceries and ponchos, clothes and shoes, she started this business 25 years ago when her children were going to school because her husband worked farming and what he earned was not sufficient to support the family, as time went by she increased sales and requests a loa to buy more merchandise and stock her store, she hopes that Kiva can help.

loans.use: to buy groceries, ponchos, jackets and shoes.

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her late 30's, is married with one child who is still a baby. Catherine has been running a tailoring business for 15 years now. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy another sewing machine and take care of her family and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy materials and make more women's clothes. Her dream is to one day be able to open a tailoring school.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Torees group" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy materials and make more women's clothes

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo tiene 38 años de edad, está casado hace 16 años con la señora Victorina de 37 años, tienen dos hijos, uno de 15 y 10 años respectivamente, el mayor está cursando el primer años de la media y la menor está en el 4to. Grado.
El sr. Pablo se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 5 años, trabajo mucho tiempo como empleado, luego salió de su trabajo y de su liquidación monto para su propio negocio, su señora tambien trabaja y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos de la familia. Pablo tiene como prioridad mantener una familia estable y que sus hijos tenga la posibilidad de terminar una carrera universitaria.                                                                         Solicita este préstamo para la compra de madera, terciadas, clavos que lo utilizará en su carpineria ya que llega fin de año y cuenta con varios pedidos y asi cumplir con su clientela.-
texts.en:
Pablo is 38 years old. He has ben married for 16 years to Victorina, who is 37. They have two children, aged 15 and 10. The oldest is in the first years of high school and the youngest is in 4th grade.
  
Pablo has been a carpenter for 5 years. He worked as an employee for many years, and later left his job. With his severance he started his own business. His wife also works and together they help each other to pay for the family expenses.
